title: sea_spider_(armored_core_vi)
body: IA-13: SEA SPIDER A boss in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A Coral-powered C-weapon developed by the Rubicon Research Institute. A hexapodal autonomous [[walker (robot)|walker]] capable of high speed terrastrial movement, leaping distances, and capable of hover flight. Outfitted with Coral-powered weapons as beams and homing missiles, as well as having a [[energy blade|Coral oscillator melee weapon]] on each of its six legs. Nicknamed ルビコニアンデスボックリ (Rubiconian Death Pinecone) from Japanese fandom, due to its shape in airborne form and [[ice_worm_(armored_core_vi)|IA-02 Ice Worm]]'s fan nickname ルビコニアンデスワーム (Rubiconian Death Worm).
other_names: ルビコニアンデスボックリ

title: open_faith_(armored_core_vi)
body:
An [[Armored Core]] [[mecha]] from [[Armored Core Vi: Fires of Rubicon]], piloted by [[V.II Snail]].

Built with full frame of VE-4xA series by Arquebus Advanced Development Division, this AC is seen with multiple sets of weapons across the game's story.

title: bangboo_(zenless_zone_zero)
body: Ehn-nah, ehn-noo ah-noo-nah... Companion units in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. Typically appear as a [[doll]]-like robot with [[rabbit ears]], though many personalized variants of bangboo exist. Invented by [[Sunbringer (zenless zone zero)|]], they were originally created to assist New Eridu residents with evacuations during Hollow disasters. Due to technological advancements, they have achieved a level of artificial intelligence on par with humans and are an indispensable part of New Eridu's daily operation. h4. title: wonderful_precure!
body:
The twenty-first installment of the [[Precure]] franchise, released in 2024. The title is actually a pun, with the [i]won[/i] part of [i]Wonderful[/i] written as [i]wan[/i] in Japanese, which is also the Japanese onomatopoeia for a dog's barking.

Animal Town is a town where animals and people live together.
Iroha loves animals and is good friends with her dog, Komugi!
One day, a mysterious monster, Garugaru wreaks havoc in the town!
However, in order to protect Iroha, Komugi transformed into a human and became a Pretty Cure...!?
Komugi has to save the child animal whose heart is being garugaru-ed...!
Let's join forces and return the animals to the Niko Garden! 

h4.Characters

* [[Inukai Komugi]] / [[Cure Wonderful]]
* [[Inukai Iroha]] / [[Cure Friendy]]
* [[Nekoyashiki Yuki]] / [[Cure Nyammy]]
* [[Nekoyashiki Mayu]] / [[Cure Lillian]]
* [[Toyama Daifuku]]
* [[Toyama Satoru]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wonderful_PreCure!

title: giga_cannon_(armored_core)
body:
One of the [[Ultimate Weapon (armored core)|]]s in [[Armored Core V]] and [[Armored Core: Verdict Day]].
It is known as ヒュージキャノン (Huge Cannon) in Japanese version.

As both names in English and Japanese versions implies, it is an [[huge weapon|oversized]] [[rocket launcher]] that launches a [[nuclear weapon|nuclear missile]].

title: unknown_(guardian)_(armored_core:_nexus)
body:
A bipedal [[mecha]] in [[Armored Core: Nexus]].

This unidentified and unmanned bipedal craft protects the Internecine factory of [[Unmanned Suicide Weapons (armored core: nexus)|]].

It was only referred to as 'Unknown' in Japanese version, but unbeknownst to developers, English version calls it '[[nineball|Nine-Ball]]' despite it had no clear connection to it. It was referred to as 'Guardian' as an in-development name in its concept art, however.

title: chinese_crested_dog
body: A small, hairless breed of [[dog]]. They are known best for their crested appearance with soft, hairless, human-like skin and tufts of hair on their paws, tail, and head. Like most hairless dog breeds, Chinese Drested Dogs come in a hairy variant referred to as a "powderpuff" that have long double coats. Both variants can appear in the same litter and the breed itself has no color standard.

title: prototype_zeta_gundam_x1
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MSZ-006-X Prototype Z Gundam x1[/b]

One of three early non-variable geometry test [[mobile_suit|MS]] prototypes of the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] for the [[AEUG]] based on [[Kamille Bidan]]'s designs and research data. 

The X1 has a head design similar to the [[Hyaku Shiki]]. It is armed with a [[beam rifle]] and a [[shield]] also similar to the one used in the [[Delta Gundam]].
other_names: プロトタイプΖガンダム

title: uehara_ayumu
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. The [i]de facto[/i] onstage leader of the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club, Ayumu is a hardworking girl that puts her all into what she does. She can be very clumsy at times. Her childhood friend, depending on medium, is either [[Takasaki Yu]] (anime) or [[Anata-chan (love live!)|]] (ALL STARS).

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]]-[[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[pink hair|pink]]-[[orange hair]], arranged in a [[half updo]] with [[swept bangs|swept]], [[blunt bangs]] (often held by [[hairclip]]s) and a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid wrapped around it]].

She is a member of [[azuna (love live!)|A・ZU・NA]] and later [[aiscream (love live!)|AiScReam!]] (together with [[Kurosawa Ruby]] and [[Wakana Shiki]]).

Voiced by [[Oonishi Aguri]].

h4. Appearance

title: 621_(armored_core_vi)
body:
The protagonist of [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]]. They are a fourth-generation augmented human, designation [b]C4-621[/b]. They were left "brain-fried" under mysterious circumstances before being sent to Rubicon III by [[Handler Walter]], ostensibly to secure the planet's valuable Coral and earn the pay necessary for restorative surgery.

As they make an illegal entry to the planet, they find a wreckage of [[Nightfall (Armored Core VI)|]] at Walter's guide, gaining access to [[ALLMIND (Armored Core VI)|]] system by stolen [[Raven (armored Core VI)|]]'s license. 

As an [[Armored Core]] character, they were never depicted directly in canon - usually in their Armored Core (starting with [[Loader 4]]), or as a completely-bandaged figure seen at the end of the story trailer.

Notable depiction in fanarts includes them [[animalization|animalized]] as a [[dog]], as they are a "hound" of Handler Walter.

title: mother_and_son
body:
Posts showing a mother and her son. It can be one of two identifiable things:

* A young boy (child or teen) and an [[mature female|older woman]] (at least middle-aged) side-by-side, or
* Two characters from a named series known to be mother and son.

h4. See also
* [[Mother and daughter]]
* [[Mother and child]]
* [[tag group:family relationships]]

title: mother_and_child
body:
Posts depicting a relationship of mother and child, where it either cannot be determined that the child is a [[mother and daughter|daughter]] or a [[mother and son|son]], or it is not warranted.

There are two identifiable criteria for this:

* the child is of indeterminate or no gender, or
* the characters depicted are not actually related as such by birth or adoption, and are merely imitating such a relationship.

h4. Other family tags

* [[Father and child]]
* [[Father and daughter]]
* [[Father and son]]

title: floppy_hat
body:
It's also called wide-brim hat, a style of hat make from straw or other woven materials, large and soft brim, protect face and shoulder from the sun. They popular for outdoor activities in the sun, beachwear, gardening, etc,...
This tag often go with [[swimsuit]], [[bikini]].

Please do not confused between [[straw hat]] and [[floppy hat]], the material to make floppy hat can be straw, wool or felt, color can be white, black, blue, etc,... any color. The brim of [[floppy hat]] always wide and soft, usually worn by women.
Meanwhile [[straw hat]]'s brim can be stiff and narrow, only made from straw (natural and synthetic) or dry stalks of cereal plants , and the color usually pale-yellow, can be worn by men or women.

title: final_fantasy_ii
body:
Second JRPG developed by Square Co., Ltd. (later [[Square Enix]]) for the [[Final Fantasy]] series. It was first released on the Famicom (NES) system on 17 December 1988. It was later ported on the WonderSwan Color (2001), PlayStation (2002) [its first-ever English release], Game Boy Advance (2004), mobile phones (2005), PlayStation Portable (2007), and Apple products (2010).

The game follows the exploits of the Wild Rose Rebellion, specifically those of the orphan [[Firion]] and his friends, as they free the world from the clutches of the Palamecian Empire and its tyrannical leader, [[Emperor (ff2)|Emperor Mateus Palamecia]].

Not to be confused with [[Final Fantasy IV]], which was initially released in the USA as the "second" game in the series.

h4. Primary Characters

* [[Firion]] (Frioniel)

title: evo_moment_#37
body:
The moment at [[Evolution Championship Series|Evolution]] 2004's [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike]] Loser's bracket final when [[Umehara Daigo]] (playing as [[ken masters|Ken]]) went against [[Justin Wong (gamer)|Justin Wong]] (playing as [[Chun-Li]]).

In the final round of match 1, Umehara's Ken was down to his last pixel of vitality. At this point, any special attack would knock Umehara's character out if connected, since special attacks deal chip damage even when blocked. In an attempt to win the round, Wong attempted to hit Umehara's Ken with Chun-Li's multihit Super Art move Houyoku-sen (鳳翼扇). 

However, instead of avoiding it, Umehara chose to "Parry," a technique whereby an incoming attack is blocked without the player losing any health, but doing so requires moving the toward opponent's direction in the same time a hit lands, within 10 frames of the impact animation. After the move was launched, not only were all 15 hits Parried, but Umehara also managed to counter with a punishing combo that dealt just enough damage to win the match. 

This moment, and the ecstatic cheering of the spectators that followed, was recorded and later spread on the Internet, gaining immense popularity, and is often credited as one of the catalysts that popularized the competitive fighting game community.

Known in Japan as "[b]The Desperate Comeback[/b] (背水の逆転劇)" or "[b]Let's go Justin[/b]", the latter a reference to a phrase yelled out by an unseen person in the crowd at the beginning of the full parry. Despite the name, the number #37 was arbitrarily added by video editor Ben Cureton, who done so to signal the viewer that this is not the only "hype" moment during the tournament.

h4. See also

* [[EVO Moment #41]]

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Official Evo Moment #37, Daigo vs Justin Evo 2004 in HD":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JzS96auqau0

body:
Female protagonist of the movie [[Kimi no Na wa.]] A 17-year old schoolgirl from the fictional country town of Itomori, somewhere in the mountains of Gifu Prefecture, Japan.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] that is usually tied into [[twin braids]] and folded up before being tied by a [[red_ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]. At one point in the film, she has it cut [[short_hair|short]], but it later regrows, by which time she wears it in a [[half updo]] or a [[nape braid|nape]] [[braid]]. Her default [[school uniform]] has a white blouse with [[short sleeves]], a red bowtie, a black [[miniskirt]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. She has also been depicted wearing a brown [[sweater vest]], a grey one paired with a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] blouse, and a blue [[yukata]].

title: pattadol
body:
One of the "Canaries" in [[Dungeon Meshi]], a squad of [[elf|elven]] criminals and nobles sent to dungeons to evaluate the danger they post to the world.

Pattadol is one of the few non-criminal members (as she has no visible notches cut into her ears), and instead acts as a warden for the others. She keeps a [[fairy]] around which she uses for communication with the rest of the squad. She has [[blonde hair]], usually in a [[half up braid]], and [[blue eyes]].

Her squadmates include:
* [[mithrun|Captain Mithrun]]
* [[Cithis]]
* [[Fleki]]
* [[Otta (dungeon meshi)|]]
* [[Lycion]]

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/676edd8f-5ba6-4f1f-bd5d-306abf0c6b87]

title: hellaverse
body: A media franchise created by Vivziepop encompassing [[Hazbin Hotel]] and its spin-off [[Helluva Boss]]. It centers around the denizens of Hell, a setting defined by its brutal and exploitative caste system that is currently undergoing an extermination crisis, though the main characters in both shows have the opposite goals.

title: helluva_boss
body:
An animated web series set in the same universe of [[Hazbin Hotel]].

The series follows the misadventures of the [b]Immediate Murder Professionals[/b], or I.M.P., an assassination group that kills humans on Earth on behalf of their clients from Hell. Lead by the demon [[Blitzo (helluva boss)|]] along with his employees, husband and wife duo, [[Moxxie (Helluva Boss)|]] and [[Millie (helluva boss)|]] and his adopted daughter [[Loona (helluva boss)|]], I.M.P. tries they best to complete their mission while dealing with other problems.

title: gast_faremis
body:
Gast Faremis is a minor, yet important character in [[Final Fantasy VII]]. A biologist, he used to be the head of Shinra's Science Research Department. Unlike his colleague and later successor [[Professor Hojo]], Gast pursued wisdom for its own sake, rather than using it to gain power. Gast is one of the few people [[Sephiroth]] respected.

Gast wears the typical [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]] of a scientist, over a [[brown shirt]], [[blue necktie]] and [[brown pants]]. His hair is [[short hair|short]] and meets his forehead in a [[widow's peak]], and he sports a drooping [[mustache]] and dark [[glasses]].

Fathered [[Aerith Gainsborough]] with [[Ifalna]].

title: final_fantasy_vii
body:
The seventh JRPG developed by Squaresoft (now [[Square Enix]]) in the [[Final Fantasy]] series, and arguably the most popular game in the series. First released on the Sony [[PlayStation 1|PlayStation]] in 31 January 1997 (after a 3-year hiatus), and then re-released for personal computers in 1998.

The story is about Avalanche, an ecoterrorist organization combating the conglomerate Shinra Electric Power Company which is destroying the world's ecosystem by extracting mako for electricity. One of their latest recruits is acerbic mercenary [[Cloud Strife]], himself a former member of SOLDIER, Shinra's mako-enhanced supersoldier corps. Soon, however, Avalanche would face an even greater enemy in the form of [[Sephiroth]], another former SOLDIER intent on absorbing the planet's power and becoming a god.

A remake, aptly titled [[Final Fantasy VII Remake]], was announced at Sony's 2015 E3 conference. The remake is a multi-game series, the first installment of which was released in April 2020. It would be followed up by [[Final Fantasy VII Rebirth]] in February 2024.

title: metal_gear_rising:_revengeance
body:
A [[science fiction]] action [[video game]] developed by [[platinumgames|Platinum Game]]s and produced by Kojima Productions. The game was originally conceived as "Metal Gear Solid: Rising".

It is a spin-off of the [[metal_gear_(series)|Metal Gear series]], focusing on the character [[Raiden (metal gear)|]] and his work with the PMC Maverick Securities after the events of [[Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns Of The Patriots]]. 

Due to the game's over-the-top narrative and characters, it has gained [[meme]]tic status since its release. In 2021, it has regained resurgence in popularity due to a meme involving [[raiden_punching_armstrong_(meme)|Raiden punching Senator Armstrong]].

title: lich_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Alternate summer version of [[Lich (Granblue Fantasy)|]].

Once cloaked in dignified darkness, the primal beast makes her descent onto the summertime shore. Through a bizarre encounter with her own shadow, she finds a quiet triumph. As the tides of her heart shift ever so slightly toward the light, she allows herself a fleeting glance in its direction.

title: gulf_war
body:
A [[war]] that took place in the Persian Gulf region from August 2, 1990, to February 28, 1991. The war was triggered by Ba'athist [[Iraq]]'s invasion and annexation of [[Kuwait]], which was seen as a threat to the security of the neighboring countries and the global oil supply.

A coalition of 34 countries, led by the [[United States]], formed to oppose [[Saddam Hussein]]'s Iraq's aggression and to liberate Kuwait. The coalition included several Arab countries, such as [[Saudi Arabia]], [[Egypt]], and [[Syria]], as well as Western countries such as the [[United Kingdom]], [[France]], and [[Canada]]. The coalition launched a massive military operation to drive Iraqi forces out of Kuwait, known as Operation Desert Storm.

The war began with a series of air strikes on Iraqi military targets, followed by a ground offensive. The coalition forces achieved a quick and decisive victory, and Kuwait was liberated from Iraqi occupation. The war lasted for less than six months, with the majority of the fighting taking place between January and February 1991.

The Gulf War had significant political, economic, and social consequences. It marked a turning point in the global politics of the Middle East, as well as in the use of military force to resolve international disputes. The war also had a severe impact on the civilian population, with thousands of Kuwaiti civilians and Iraqi civilians being killed or displaced.

The war also led to the imposition of sanctions on Iraq, which remained in place for over a decade, and had a significant impact on the country's economy and population. Additionally, the Gulf War led to the deployment of US military forces in the region, which has had a lasting impact on the politics and security of the Middle East.

h4. See Also
* [[Iraq War]] - [i]The war in Iraq that began with the invasion by a U.S.-led coalition in 20 March 2003, to the formal U.S. withdrawl on 15 December 2011.[/i]
* [[tag_group:history|Tag group: History]]
* [[Jarhead]]

h4. External link
* "Wikipedia: Gulf War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_War]

title: buena_vista_(umamusume)
body:
An [[Umamusume]] character. Voiced by [[Izumi Fuuka]].

Similarly to [[Orfevre (umamusume)|]], she was originally introduced in the old project website but was later withdrawn, only to be re-introduced with a new design in 2024.

If [[Cesario (umamusume)|]] copied [[Special Week (umamusume)|]]'s general looks, Buena Vista is a closer match to Special Week's personality while her racing outfit also matches Special Week's but in her own style, featuring her signature checkerboard pattern. Personality-wise, Buena is notably far more friendlier to almost everyone.

h4. Appearance

title: echo_(armored_core_vi)
body:
An unmanned bipedal AC [[mecha]] in [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

Reassembled within <spoiler>[[allmind (armored core vi)|ALLMIND]]'s</spoilers> classified simulations, the new designation 'Echo' is without a serial code, though its made up with parts produced by the Rubicon Research Institute under the serial code IA-C01X 'Ephemera', originally developed for an unmanned AC of same name.

Despite the parts being developed half a century prior, like all Institute developed machines, it is able to keep up and exceed modern weapons in many aspects thanks to it's Coral-powered technology. The AC Echo has an alien but yet feminine appearance, it is painted entirely in black, silver and pink.

<spoilers>Though designed to be unmanned, when it's reassembled into the Echo, it was piloted by Ayre in the story route 'Alea Iacta Est' to assist the [[621 (Armored Core Vi)|C4-621]] in the final mission.</spoilers>

title: tuscaloosa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Tuscaloosa[/i] (CA-37). Character designed by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]], gradient [[necktie]], triangular [[hairclip]], [[blue skirt]], [[two-tone gloves]], [[chest harness]]es, [[white dress|white half-dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two of her three historical 203 mm triple gun mounts with two [[aircraft catapult]]s, one of each on each side, held together by a [[smokestack|funnel]] piece to her back, and painted in base grey.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Abyssal Heavy Cruiser Water Princess]].

title: pastel_goth
body:
Western fashion style derivative of [[goth fashion]], with some similarities to [[yami kawaii]] and [[gurokawa]], primarily using dreamy pastel colors such as purple, pink, blue, and mint green contrasted with black. It emerged from [[Tumblr]] in the early 2010s.

Common visual motifs include dripping patterns, [[inverted cross]]es, [[eyeball]]s, [[bat (animal)|]]s, [[bone]]s, galaxy prints, [[crystal]]s, and [[ghost]]s. Gradients are also especially commonplace. Hair is often long and pastel-colored with an [[gradient hair|ombré]] dye effect.

Popular clothing choices include oversized [[sweater]]s, [[pleated skirt]]s, torn [[pantyhose]], and [[vest]]s layered over other clothes. Additionally, accessories such as [[spiked hairband]]s, [[head wreath]]s, [[thigh strap]]s, [[thighhighs]] with a skeletal or cross print, and [[hair bow]]s decorated with fake eyeballs are often worn. Footwear typically consists of [[mary janes]], [[boots]], [[platform shoes]], or [[sneakers]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8991357
* !post #7033393
* !post #9277280
* !post #9724391

h4. See also

* [[Perky Goth]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Pastel Goth":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Pastel_Goth

title: medieval
body:
[b]The Medieval period[/b] (also known as [b]the Middle Ages[/b]) was a time period in Europe that lasted for 1000 years, from the end of classical antiquity (conventionally dated to the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476) until the early modern period around 1500 (roughly coinciding with the widespread use of the printing press and the discovery of the New World). Today, the Middle Ages are synonymous with [[knight]]s and high [[fantasy]] aesthetics.

At Danbooru, this tag should be used for fashion that the typical Western audience would consider to pertain to this era, such as knight's armor, gowns with long sleeves, laced sandals, boots, and even cloaks. It also covers pre-modern European architecture such as castles.

This should not be confused with the [[Renaissance]] period, which came after/during the Late Middle Ages and marked the onset of early modern era.

h4. See also
* [[Holy Roman Empire]]

title: xingqiu_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

The second son of the Feiyun Commerce Guild, Xingqiu has had a reputation for being studious and polite ever since he was a young child.
But there is another side to the mild-mannered Xingqiu everyone knows. A daring, adventurous, and much more mischievous side...

His name is pronounced [b]Yukuaki[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Xingqiu has dark, navy [[blue hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] and [[yellow_eyes|golden amber eyes]]. He has a slight frame and a light skin tone. He typically wears a blue [[earrings|earring]] with a gold [[tassel_earrings|tassel]] on his right ear. He is the only character who wears a [[single_earring|single right earring]]. Other characters either have two earrings, no earrings, or a single left earring. His [[vision_(genshin_impact)|vision]] is pinned to the bottom of the left side of his coat on top of a span of frilled, white fabric. A tassel made of amber which matches his eyes hangs from the vision.

His attire consists of a [[long_coat|long coat]] of silk which gradients from black at the collar, to shades of navy blue as the material descends. The coat's underneath is colored a contrasting yellow and a faint, wavy pattern which alludes to his hydro vision is situated all over the fabric. His [[frilled_shirt_collar|collar]] and shoulder plates are rimmed with a gold, metallic material and to the right side of his chest sits a large and circular [[brooch|brooch]]. It's embedded with a blue jewel, alike the center of his collar, coat buttons and sleeve cuffs (front and side). Underneath, Xingqiu wears a white [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[shirt|shirt]] with a frilled seam to the right, revealed by the slit of his coat behind two overlapping ribbon-like buttons. He additionally wields distinct, [[frilled_sleeves|frilled sleeves]] which extend from his coat's baggy, gold pair. A clover-like [[ribbon|ribbon]] of white, black and yellow is pinned to the right side of his [[belt|belt]]. Beneath this hangs a pair of rectangular ribbons, one in white covering a notably longer, black ribbon. Both of them wield gold decals at their ends. He also wears a pair of navy-[[blue_shorts|blue shorts]] with ends of black that are mostly concealed by the length of his coat. On his right leg, Xingqiu wears a [[frilled thigh strap|garter]] with a blue tassel, just below the knee. His footwear consists of a pair of white high-calf [[boots|boots]], black at the [[high_heels|heels]] and soles with gold motifs.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4146847: Default
* !post #9724232: [[Xingqiu (Bamboo Rain) (Genshin Impact)|Bamboo Rain]]
* !post #7672835: [[Xingqiu (Gigo) (Genshin Impact)|Gigo]]
* !post #5600590: [[Xingqiu (Aoi No Okina) (Genshin Impact)|Aoi no Okina]]

body:

title: revenant_(elden_ring)
body:
Revenant is a character and playable Hero in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. She is one of the eight available player classes. Not to be confused with the [[Royal Revenant (elden ring)|]].

Revenant is a summoner with [[white hair]], [[low twin braids]], [[blue eyes]], a blue [[head wreath]] or [[flower wreath]], [[cracked skin]], [[doll joints]] and a [[claw ring]]. She plays a [[lyre]], not to be confused with a [[harp]].

Due to the contrast of her diminutive height, serene appearance, fixation on revenge and antisocial behavior, and her lack of reliable stat scaling for most weapons, she has been memetically depicted as an angry gremlin-like creature who wields Colossal Weapons (which deal plenty of damage even without scaling) which look even even larger when used by her.

title: ghost_(armored_core_vi)
body:
[b]IA-27: GHOST[/b]

An enemy unit that appears in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

It is a black bipedal, unmanned [[mecha]] with a large dish with multiple red sensors making up its torso and no head.

It can come with multiple types of armaments, such as multiple types of [[energy gun]]s, [[energy whip]] and [[energy shield]]. But most importantly, Ghost is capable of MDD (Monitor Display Desception) Jamming, which is a form of [[optical camouflage]] against other mechs, which makes it a great scout.

title: postage_stamp
body:
A postage stamp is a small piece of paper that is purchased and displayed on an item of mail as evidence of payment of postage.
The stamp’s shape is usually that of a small rectangle of varying proportions, though triangles or other shapes are occasionally used.

Before the introduction of postage stamps, recipients were unable or unwilling to pay for delivered items, and senders had no incentive to restrict the number, size, or weight of items sent. The postage stamp resolved this issue in a simple and elegant manner, with the additional benefit of room for an element of beauty to be introduced.

h4. External Links

* Wikipedia: "Postage Stamp":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postage_stamp

title: void_linux
body:
Lightweight, independent (meaning it was not derived/forked from another distribution), general-purpose [[Linux]]-based operating system started in 2008 that aims for efficiency and performance, while mixing stability and bleeding-edge. It currently only "officially" supports either a headless/[[terminal]]-only or an [[Xfce]] release, but the user can install and configure any number of other desktop environments, like [[GNOME (Software)|GNOME]] or [[kde|KDE Plasma]] for instance, from its package manager.

Its name comes from the C language keyword "void".

Although not as popular as many of the big names in the GNU/Linux sphere, it consistently ranks very high on "DistroWatch":[https://distrowatch.com/dwres.php?resource=ranking] in terms of ratings.

h4. External Links
* "Official website":[https://voidlinux.org/]
* "Wikipedia page":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Void_Linux]

title: m1_garand
body:
The M1 Garand is a semi-automatic [b][[rifle]][/b] that was adopted in 1936 as the standard-issue weapon of the United States military. Replacing the bolt-action [[M1903 Springfield]] and [[M1917 Enfield]] rifles, the Garand was the first semi-automatic weapon to be designated as the primary weapon of any army, and saw service with American troops on all fronts of [[World War II]] and the [[Korean War]]. 

The weapon is loaded via an eight-round [[clip (weapon)|en-bloc clip]] inserted from the top, and makes a distinctive and famous "ping" sound when ejecting the clip after the last round has been fired. The Garand can also be reloaded mid-clip, either by opening the action and inserting loose rounds or by manually ejecting the partially-spent clip and loading a fresh one. 

Though the M1 was officially replaced by the [[M14]] rifle in 1958, which married the action of the M1 with the magazine capacity of the [[M1918 bar|Browning Automatic Rifle]], the Garand was not fully replaced in active-duty service until 1965, and remained in specialist sniper or reserve roles into the 1970s. The Garand also saw extensive action during the [[Vietnam War]] as the primary weapon of both the [[Republic of Korea Army]] and the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] until the late 60s. It continues to be used by drill and ceremonial teams today, and have even been found in modern-day conflicts such as the [[War in Afghanistan]] and the [[Iraq War]]. It is also widely seen in media, movies, and video games, particularly any depiction of America's involvement in the Second World War. 

h4. See Also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M14]]
* [[M1 Garand (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links
*  "Wikipedia: M1 Garand":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1_Garand

title: ayre_(armored_core_vi)
body:
A supporting character who appears midway through [[Armored Core VI: Fires Of Rubicon]].

The player character first encounters her as a disembodied voice in his head, along with a red cast over their vision. She is [spoiler]a persona existing within the Coral, who seeks to unify it and humanity. Though suspected by [[Handler Walter]] to be the harbinger of a horrific assimilation plot, she is in fact quite hopeful that humanity and Coral can forge a strong and genuine bond.[/spoiler] 

As [spoiler]a disembodied voice[/spoiler] and an [[Armored Core]] character, she has no canon appearance [spoiler]aside from a spark of Coral[/spoiler]. In most fanarts, she has red-tinted [[pale skin]], [[red eyes]], and [[white hair]], which likely is inspired by the colorations of <spoilers>[[SOL 644]] and [[Echo (Armored Core VI)|]]</spoilers>, and/or [[albino]] in general.

Voiced By: Erin Yvette (EN), [[Fairouz Ai]] (JP)

title: hamas
body:
[b]Hamas[/b] (Arabic: حركة المقاومة الإسلامية, Ḥarakat al-Muqāwamah al-ʾIslāmiyyah, lit. '[[Islam]]ic Resistance Movement'), is a [[palestine|Palestinian]] Islamist political and paramilitary movement founded on 10 December 1987. The group played a prominent role on [[israel-hamas war|guerrilla warfare]] against the [[israel defense forces|IDF]]. 

Hamas has been accused of political violence and alleged human rights violations, particularly by Israel's allies. Therefore, many countries that have positive relationships with Israel designated Hamas as a [[terrorist]] organization.

Hamas personnel are generally recognizable by their head-wrapping [[keffiyeh]]s and [[green headband]]s often inscribed with [[arabic text|shahada]] text based on their party flag.


h4. See also
* [[Hezbollah flag|Hezbollah]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Hamas":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas

title: momosuzu_nene_(cheerleader)
body:
The 4th/[[Cheerleader]] [[official alternate costume| costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Momosuzu Nene]], debuting on June 10th, 2023. Unlike her past outfits that were designed by her original artist ([[Nishizawa]]), this one was designed by [[Anmi]].

It consisting of a [[pink hat|pink]] [[sideways hat|sideways]] [[visor cap]], a [[frilled choker|frilled]] [[pink choker]], either a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white tank top]] with her name [[clothes writing|written on it]] with a [[pink sash|pink]] [[frilled sash]] going from her right shoulder to her left armpit or a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[off-shoulder shirt]], pink [[arm garter]]s and [[wrist cuffs]], a [[layered skirt|layered]] [[pink skirt|pink]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[waist bow|waist]] [[bow skirt|bow]] and a [[Nekko (momosuzu nene)|]] [[character doll|doll]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[white boots]] [[inline skates]].

For her 3rd anniversary on December 2023 she got an optional [[red capelet|red]] [[fur-trimmed capelet]] with a [[brown ribbon|brown]] [[neck ribbon|ribbon]] and a [[crown]] formed by multiple [[Nekko (momosuzu nene)|]]. On May 2024 to celebrate her 1000th video on YouTube she got an optional [[blue shirt|blue]] [[cropped shirt]] with [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[long sleeves]] with "[[clothes writing|NEMUSUGII]] [[number print|5]]" printed on the center and a [[pink choker|pink]] [[frilled choker]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]]s with this costume:

* [[medium hair|Medium]]-to-[[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] tied into a [[one side up]] with a [[single hair ring]] held with a [[hair bow]] with a [[peach hair ornament]] and multiple [[hairclip]]s, including 2 [[heart hair ornament|heart-shaped]] ones and one with her name
* [[twin drills|Twin-drilled]] medium blonde hair with [[long sidelocks]] and [[blunt bangs]] tied into [[pink ribbon|two pink ribbons]] adorned with [[pink flower|pink]] [[hair flower|flowers]]
* Long [[messy hair|messy]] blonde hair with long sidelocks that fall over her [[hair over shoulder|shoulders]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6387298: Profile (without pom poms)
* !post #6387299: Profile (with pom poms)

Being rejected from Wonderland, she now wears a [[pink dress|pink]] [[halterneck]] [[dress]] with [[white sleeves]], a [[white scarf]], a [[black choker]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[white thighhighs|white]] and [[blue thighhighs]], [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]], and a [[pink hat|pink]] [[beret]], and is paired with a [[blue bag|blue]] [[backpack]].

title: ema_skye
body:
A detective and forensics "expert" despite not passing her forensics exams. [[Phoenix Wright]] helped her out in a past case, so she repays the favor by helping [[Apollo Justice]] and [[Trucy Wright]] in their cases. Skye loves snacks, and gets annoyed easily. Her snack of choice is [[karintou]] (localized as snackoos).

She has [[green eyes|green]]/[[aqua eyes|aqua]] eyes and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. When she was 16, she had it tied into a [[topknot]], but as she got older, she switched to a [[half updo]], instead.

Her outfits vary game-by-game, but all of them share a pair of [[white-framed eyewear|white-framed]]-and-[[pink-tinted eyewear|pink]] glasses [[eyewear on head|on her head]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]], a [[white coat|white]] [[open coat|open]] [[coat]] with [[lapels]] and [[sleeves rolled up|rolled up sleeves]], a [[wristwatch]], a [[shoulder bag]] of sorts, and at least one [[button badge]].

In [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]], when she was 16, she wore a [[red bowtie|red]] [[bowtie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt|mini]][[skirt]], a [[pink bag|pink]] [[shoulder bag]] with [[vial]]s inside, a pair of [[red socks|red]] [[kneehighs]], and [[red shoes|red]] [[loafers]].

In [[Ace Attorney Investigations]], when she was 18, she wore a [[pink hat|pink]] [[newsboy cap]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[striped necktie|striped]] [[necktie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[black bag|black]] [[shoulder bag]], a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[brown shorts|brown]] [[shorts]], and a pair of [[black thighhighs|black]][[two-tone thighhighs|-and-]][[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|under]] a pair of [[brown boots|brown]] [[lace-up boots]].

In [[Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney]], when she was 25, she wore a [[red neckerchief|red]] [[neckerchief]], a [[green vest|green]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[red bag|red]] [[shoulder bag]] with [[vial]]s inside, a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[brown pants|brown]] [[capri pants|capri]] [[pants]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]].

In [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice]], when she was 27, she mostly reprised her outfit from AJ:AA, except she also wore a [[red armband|red]]/[[brown armband]] [[armband]] with a [[text print|text]] [[print armband]] noting her position in the police force.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8845946: [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]]
* !post #8845967: [[Ace Attorney Investigations]]
* !post #8845955: [[Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney]]
* !post #8845969: [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice]]

body:
A [[official alternate costume|rare skin]] for [[Wattson (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of the second Arenas Flash Event in Season 9.

In this apperance, Wattson's default outfit is recolored into a [[yume kawaii|Harajuku]][[decora|-inspired]] [[pastel colors|pastel-colored]] outfit with a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[hooded jacket]] and [[pink bodysuit]] over a [[yellow bodysuit|yellow]] [[ribbed bodysuit]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] graphic, as well as a [[pink hood]] adorned with small [[red bow|red]], [[green bow|green]], and [[purple bow]]s. She also wears [[pink eyeshadow]] and several [[sticker]]s under her right eye in this skin.
other_names: かわいい電圧ワットソン

title: ciel_phantomhive_(robin_dress)
body: [[Official alternate costume]] of [[Ciel Phantomhive]] featuring him dressed in a [[pink dress|pink]] [[lolita fashion|lolita]] [[dress]] with a [[pink hat]] and [[twintails]]. (Also known as "Lady Phantomhive" and "Komadori")

title: princess_peach_(nightgown)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] in [[sleepwear]], shown briefly in one of the animation stickers from the Japanese messaging app [[LINE (naver)|]], stickers which were officially created by [[Nintendo]]. This design was released in a set of images called [i]Super Mario's Relaxing Life[/i].

She wears a [[sleeveless]] [[pink nightgown|pink]] [[nightgown]] along with a [[pink hat|pink]] [[mob cap]]. Her hair is also slightly more [[messy hair|messy]] compared to her default design, usually represented by giving her [[swept bangs]].

h4. Official Art

* !asset #24551768: Full animation: asset #24551592

title: calem_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Calem[/b], known as [b]Calme[/b] in Japan, is the male player character in [[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]].

A stoic Trainer in pursuit of strength, he conceals his burning desire to grow stronger and plays it cool outwardly [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He wears [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on headwear|on]] a [[red hat]], a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[turtleneck jacket]], a [[mega ring]], [[skinny jeans]], [[black boots]], and carries a [[black bag|black]] [[messenger bag]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]X[/b].

h4. Official art

title: serena_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Serena[/b] is the female player character in [[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]].

This Trainer from Kalos loves Pokémon and fashion. She's usually cheerful and upbeat, but when a battle starts, her demeanor shifts, revealing her calm, serious side [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[pink hat]] [[eyewear on headwear|with]] [[white-framed eyewear|white-framed]] [[sunglasses]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[mega ring]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[thighhighs]], [[black shoes]], and a [[pink bag|pink]] [[handbag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Yvonne Gabena[/b] or Y.

title: caitlin_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Caitlin[/b], known as [b]Cattleya[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon platinum|Pokémon Platinum]].

One of the Unova Pokémon League Elite Four, this refined young lady overcame her past weaknesses and became a stronger Trainer [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

In [[pokemon bw|BW]], she has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[pink hat]], [[butterfly hair ornament|butterfly hair ornaments]], a [[see-through cape|transparent]] [[pink cape]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[white dress|dress]], and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[wedge heels]] (post #5196529).

h4. Official Art

title: dixie_kong
body:
A member of the Kong Family introduced in [[Donkey Kong Country 2|Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest]], and a very infrequent participant in [[Mario (series)|]] spinoffs since [[Mario Superstar Baseball]].

A lover of adventure, her most significant trait is her [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[ponytail]] hair that is shaped like banana. It's used for attacking, picking up items and allows her to twirl in the air like a helicopter. 

She has [[green eyes]] with visible [[eyelashes]]. She wears blue [[sphere earrings|spherical earrings]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[sleeveless shirt]] that's [[tied shirt|tied]] in the front and a [[pink hat|pink]] [[beret]]. Her beret used to have the Rare Ltd logo but has since been removed, the same goes for her knee pads.

She is [[Diddy Kong]]'s girlfriend, [[Kiddy Kong]]'s cousin and  was [[Tiny Kong]]'s older sister.

title: ranger_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]] which lets [[Kirby]] wield a [[blunderbuss]] that fires [[star (symbol)|]] [[bullet]]s.

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[pink hat]] with a [[star hat ornament|star]] in its center.

h4. Icon

!asset #24958371

h4. See also

* [[Noble Ranger Kirby]]
* [[Space Ranger Kirby]]

title: needle_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] shoot [[needle]]s at enemies.

In this form, Kirby wears a [[pink hat|pink]] [[baseball cap]] with a yellow visor that is decorated with countless [[needle]]s. In some games, Kirby's skin turns [[yellow skin|yellow]].

h4. Icon

!asset #24731353

h4. See also

* [[Clutter Needle Kirby]]
* [[Crystal Needle Kirby]]

title: aglaea_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. A member of the [[Chrysos Heirs (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]] (JP) and [[Morgan Garrett]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her outfit is [[Greco-Roman clothes|Greco-Roman]] in theme and consists of a golden [[laurel crown]], ornate [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]], laurel-themed black [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, single [[shoulder armor]] on her left, and [[gold sandals|gold]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[gladiator sandals]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8704034: Splash art
* !post #8765103: Time Woven Into Gold (signature Light Cone)
* !post #9175510: [[Aglaea (mom's touch) (honkai: star rail)|Mom's Touch]] collab dress (left)

h4. See also

* [[Aponia]] - her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: astral_treasure_loba
body: [[official alternate costume|Epic skin]] for [[Loba (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 15's battle pass. This skin recolors her default appearance to have [[black pants]] and [[gold boots]], as well as golden implants on her face and chest.

title: hi-jump_kirby
body:
An occasional [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby series]] that allows [[Kirby]] to jump incredibly high, destroying any enemy in the way.
This ability is obtained mainly by swallowing [[Starman_(kirby)|]].
In this form, kirby wears a [[wing hat ornament|winged]], yellow [[circlet]] and a [[blue cape|blue]] and [[red cape|red]] [[cape]].

In [[Kirby's Dream Buffet]], a Hi-Jump Gummy can be obtained to transform.
Kirby transforms into a [[spring (object)|]]-like form, jumps, and collects strawberries while attacking the surrounding area with the impact of his landing.
other_names: ハイジャンプカービィ

title: awane_kokoro
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

h4. Appearance

Her [[brown hair]] is typically tied into [[hair rings|rings]], leaving out a [[single sidelock|single]] [[low-tied sidelocks|low-tied sidelock]], and decorated with [[cube hair ornament|cubes]]. She also has [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[diagonal bangs]] and [[green eyes]].

In her daily life, she wears [[Chuo Academy school uniform]] paired with [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears a [[yellow hat]], a [[black bodysuit|black]] or [[grey bodysuit|grey]] [[sleeveless bodysuit|sleeveless]] with a [[collared bodysuit|collar]], a [[white ascot|white]] [[ascot]] with a [[green gemstone|green]] [[brooch]], a [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[crop top|crop]] [[shirt|top]] with a [[zipper]], [[yellow gloves|yellow]] [[gloves]], am [[orange skirt|orange]] [[showgirl skirt]] with a [[red gemstone]] and [[yellow boots]].

* !asset #23404715
* !asset #23404716: [[Magical girl]]
* !asset #23404718: [[awane kokoro (outdoor costume)|Outdoor costume]]

title: yuuki-chan_(kanabun)
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Kanabun]].

She is a [[loli]] with [[red eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with bangs [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. She wears a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[baseball cap|cap]] with the word "INU" on it and has a [[bandaid]] [[bandaid on face|on her face]].

Her sisters are [[Mizuki-chan (kanabun)|]] and [[Natsumi-chan (kanabun)|]].

h4.See Also
* "ビーチであそぼ":[/pools/17976]

title: noto_gin
body: A male character in [[Caligula (series)|]] [[Caligula 2|2]]. He has [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]] and wears a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[baseball cap]].

title: kuroe_(swimsuit_ver.)_(madoka_magica)
body:
A [[official alternate costume|playable variant]] of [[Kuroe (madoka magica)|]] from [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]].

She wears a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[straw hat]] with a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hat ribbon|ribbon]], a [[coral hat ornament|coral]], a [[shell hat ornament|shell]] and a [[purple flower|purple]] [[hat flower]]; a [[bead necklace|bead]] [[necklace]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[see-through jacket|see-through]] [[jacket]] with a [[hooded jacket|ho]][[hood down|od]], [[long sleeves]] and a [[print jacket|print]] consisting of [[wave print|waves]] and [[star print|stars]]; a [[dress swimsuit|dress-like]] [[casual one-piece swimsuit|casual]] [[purple one-piece swimsuit|purple]] [[one-piece swimsuit]] with [[spaghetti strap]]s, [[side cutout]]s and a [[swimsuit skirt]]; a [[bead bracelet]] and a [[flower bracelet|flower]] [[bracelet]], a [[thighlet]] with a [[purple gemstone]], and [[brown sandals|brown]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[sandals]] with [[footwear flower|flowers]]. She fights using a [[paddle]].

title: juniper_woods
body:
The defendant in case 1 and 3 of [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies]]. An old friend of [[Athena Cykes]] who has a crush on [[Apollo Justice]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with [[sidelocks]], decorated with [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[sunflower|sunflowers]].

In her casual outfit, she has her hair tied into [[twin braids]] with [[bun ends]] using [[green bow|green]] [[leaf hair ornament|leaf-shaped]] [[hair bow|bow]]s. She wears a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[sun hat]] with [[hat flower|flowers]], a [[yellow capelet|yellow]] [[hooded capelet|hooded]] [[cable knit]] [[capelet]] with [[acorn]] [[buttons]], a [[yellow bowtie|yellow]] [[bowtie]] with a [[pinecone]], a [[long dress|long]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with [[sleeves rolled up|rolled up sleeves]] and [[frilled dress|frills]], a pair of [[white gloves|white]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[gloves]], [[brown pantyhose]] and a pair of [[brown shoes]].

At her school, she leaves her [[hair down]], decorated with a single [[hair flower|flower]]. She wears the [[Themis Legal Academy school uniform]], consisting of a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[ribbed dress|ribbed]] [[dress]] with a [[wing collar]], the [[school emblem]] and [[long sleeves|long]] [[juliet sleeves]] with [[sleeve cuffs|cuffs]]; a [[yellow neckerchief|yellow]] [[neckerchief]], a pair of [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]].

She is often seen [[knitting]], or simply holding [[knitting needle]]s.

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Morizumi Shinobu (森澄 しのぶ / もりずみ しのぶ)

title: katie_(animal_crossing)
body:
A yellow [[cat]] from the [[Animal Crossing]] franchise. She randomly appears in the player's town lost, wishing to be reunited with her mother [[Kaitlin (animal crossing)|]]. Helping her find her mother can only be done in multiplayer. 
She has [[brown hair|brown]] bangs, like her mother, and wears a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[dress]]. Since [i]New Leaf[/i], she appears slightly older and now also has a [[yellow hat]] resembling a [[school hat]].

h4. External links

* "Animal Crossing Wiki: Katie":http://animalcrossing.wikia.com/wiki/Katie
* "Nookipedia: Katie":http://nookipedia.com/wiki/Katie

title: sand_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[sand|sand-based]] [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[yellow crown]] that resembles [[pyramid|pyramids]] with a [[green gemstone]] in its center, with [[sand]] coming out of his head.

title: cutter_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby_(series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] throw [[boomerang]]s at his enemies, as well as cut ropes in later games.

In this form, Kirby wears a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[baseball cap]] decorated with [[wing hat ornament|wings]] on the sides, as well as [[eye print|eyes]] on the front, making it almost resemble a [[duck]]. When not in use, a [[boomerang]] rests on top of the hat.

It is also inspired by [[Ultraseven]]'s [[Eye Slugger]].

h4. Icon

!asset #24553653

h4. See also

* [[Chakram Cutter Kirby]]
* [[Buzz-Saw Cutter kirby]]

title: wario
body:
[[Mario]]'s self-proclaimed rival. A crass, selfish, greedy anti-hero who sports superhuman strength. Frequently breaks the [[fourth wall]] in various promotional material. Partner in crime with [[Waluigi]] and stars in his own series: [[Wario Land]] and [[WarioWare]]. 

His trademark appearance is having a [[yellow shirt]], a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[baseball cap|cap]] with a "W" and [[purple overalls|purple overalls]]. He also has [[white gloves]], [[green shoes|green]] [[pointy shoes]], a zig-zagged [[mustache]] and a big [[pink nose]]. He used to have long sleeves, but ever since [[Wario Land II]] he is now depicted with having [[short sleeves]] to emphasize his [[muscular|muscles]]. 

His name is a combination of [b]Wa[/b]rui (わるい, Japanese for bad, evil, etc.) and Ma[b]rio[/b] to produce [b]Wario[/b].

title: batter_(rhythm_tengoku)
body:
A character from the 2011 game [[Minna no Rhythm Tengoku]] of the [[Rhythm Tengoku]] series. He is depicted as a male [[baseball]] batter and features alongside [[Pitcher (Rhythm Tengoku)|]].

He has a somewhat cartoonish style with large eyes with [[dot pupils]], no visible hair, and typically depicting as having a somewhat [[angry]] expression with [[v-shaped eyebrows]] and [[clenched teeth]].  He wears a [[yellow shirt|yellow]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[two-tone shirt|two-tone]] [[baseball jersey]], and [[white pants]].  He also wears a [[yellow helmet|yellow]] [[baseball helmet]], [[yellow shoes|yellow]] [[shoes]], [[white gloves]], and a [[black belt]].  He uses a [[baseball bat]].

* !asset #23356163

title: minato_mio
body:
Secondary protagonist of [[Aikatsu Friends!]] and an [[idol]], a [[star harmony academy school uniform|Star Harmony Academy]] student. She's [[Yuki Aine]]'s partner in the friend unit named Pure Palette.

She has [[medium_hair|medium]] [[gradient hair]] consisting of the color [[blue hair|blue]] and [[purple_hair|purple]] worn in a [[half up braid]], and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[star hair ornament]] in her hair which she changes to a shooting star in the second season.

title: saegusa_riko
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[ririko (zhuoyandesailaer)]]. Her [[sisters|sister]] is [[saegusa_futaba|Futaba]].

She has [[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]] with a [[half up braid]] and [[double-parted bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].

title: momiji_ayaka
body:
Character from [[Kokoro iroduku Koi ga shitai]]. In love with her childhood friend [[Kaneshiro Kou]].

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium hair|medium length]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs|swept]] [[bangs]] and stylized in [[twin braids]] and a [[nape braid|nape]] [[braid]], and [[medium breasts]]. Wears a [[x hair ornament]].

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[blue bow]], a [[red cardigan|red]] [[cardigan]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and [[black thighhighs]].

At the [[beach]] she wears a [[black bikini]].

title: vhs_(keeper_on_page_8)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[VHS (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Operation Dusk' skin collection from 2020 through shop purchase.

For her urban trek, she's put on a [[grey hat|grey]] [[beanie]] and headphones, trying her [[long hair]] into a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[green jacket|green]] [[camouflage jacket]], with a [[red scarf]], a [[load bearing vest]], [[orange gloves]], her namesake gun on a [[gun sling]], and carrying a small [[briefcase]]. All of this [[bodysuit under clothes|covers]] her [[blue bodysuit]], with her art emphasizing her [[ass]], complete with [[dimples of Venus]]. Alongside some [[thigh strap]]s and a [[thigh holster]] holding a knife, her attire is complete with [[orange boots|orange]] [[boots]]. Like her base damaged art, this skin's damaged art also references [[Bite the Dust (jojo)|]], with Killer Queen's recognizable pose.

title: mistress_of_evil_wraith
body: A [[official alternate costume|legendary skin]] for [[Wraith (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], originally released as part of 2019's Fight or Fright Halloween event. In this appearance Wraith is a [[green skin]]ned [[witch]], wearing a [[grey hat|grey]] [[witch hat]], [[purple shirt]], [[black corset]], [[purple scarf]], [[black skirt]] with a [[brown belt]], and [[bandaged leg]]s with [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

title: crash_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|]] series that lets [[Kirby]] destroy any enemy (and severely damage bosses) once. 

In this form, Kirby wears a [[grey crown]] encased in a [[glass]] dome that contains a [[nuclear reactor]] within with a [[star hat ornament|star]] on the top.

h4. Icon

!asset #24958655

h4. See also

* [[Time Crash Kirby]]

title: langley_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], her callsign is likely a nod to Langley of Fairfax county, Virginia, the real world location of US Central Intelligence Agency HQ. Voiced by [[Kobayashi Yuu]].

Langley the Silver Spider, an S rank Sinner and an agent in service to the 9th Agency of DisCity. Her alignment is Treachery.

Langley has a noir detective style appearance, she has [[medium hair|medium]] length [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]], wears [[black eyeshadow]], [[eyeliner]] and [[black lips|black lipstick]] make up, and has a silver [[spider tattoo]] on her left [[facial tattoo|temple]]. Wears a [[single earring|single]] [[floating earrings|dangle earring]] on her left ear and a [[mole on neck|mole]] on the left side of her neck. Typically seen wearing a [[white hat|white]]/[[grey hat|grey]] [[fedora]] or [[trilby]] with a [[hat feather]].

She wears a [[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[pink necktie|pink]] [[striped necktie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pencil skirt]], and a [[grey jacket]] [[jacket on shoulders|on her shoulders]]. Wears a pair of [[black gloves|black]]/[[leather gloves|leather]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[black boots|black]]/[[leather boots|leather]] [[thigh boots]]. Usually seen with a long barrelled [[handgun]] and a walking [[cane]].

h4. Appearance

title: paint_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby Super Star]] and [[Kirby Super Star Ultra|its remake]] that lets [[Kirby]] cause different things to happen to the bosses he fights once.

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[grey hat|grey]] [[backwards hat|backwards-facing]] [[baseball cap]] and holds a [[paint can]] and [[paintbrush]].

Not to be confused with [[Artist Kirby]].

title: narmaya_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Playable dark-type character in [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i]. Makes an appearance in the fighting game spin-off, [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]]; the fighting game's sequel, [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]]; and the action-RPG spin off, [[Granblue Fantasy: Relink]].

A  [[katana]]-wielding [[draph]] girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[purple hair]] adorned with hair ornaments that's fashioned with two [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] frontal locks, a [[single braid|single left-sided braid]], and [[hair over one eye|bangs draped over her left eye]]. Has horns are black and curve towards the front. Like most draph characters, she also has [[large breasts]].

Wears a [[sleeveless]] coat that is closed at the top. Underneath is a black vest-like garment with various belts with what seems to be [[bottomless|no bottom]]. Her legwear consists of a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black]] thighhigh on her left leg and a [[black boots|black boot]] on her right along with a [[thigh strap]] (both footwear having [[high heels]]). Lastly, she has [[black gloves|black]] [[uneven gloves|uneven]] [[elbow gloves]].

Narmaya has a overall airy and aloof demeanor. She is rather obsessive over the [[gran (granblue fantasy)|main]] [[djeeta (granblue fantasy)|character]], constantly babying and worrying about him/her whilst wanting to be seen as a big sister.

Due to her popularity, she has been given a number of alternate versions: an SSR Water Summer version in 2016, an SSR Earth Holiday version in 2019 and a Grand version in 2021.

Voiced by [[Ichimichi Mao]]

title: umapyoi_(phrase)
body:
うまぴょい [tn]Umapyoi, "horseyhop!"[/tn]

Slang coined by the [[Umamusume]] fanbase, deriving from the title and song lyrics of the [[Umapyoi Densetsu]] song. Generally used in the sense of: 1. To finish a given [[horse girl]]'s training scenario in the [[Umamusume]] game; 2. To get along very well or "buddy buddy" with a given girl (or [[Kiryuin Aoi]]); or 3. To "go all the way" or do all sorts of implied hanky panky things with a given girl (or again, [[Kiryuin Aoi]]). 

Effectively used as a euphemism in most fan comics, especially in 'comedic' scenarios, where it usually involves a girl going [[yandere]] on the [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] and alleging the latter [i]umapyoi[/i]-ing the other girls. Occasionally it is [[Happy Meek (Umamusume)|]] accusing [[Kiryuin Aoi]] (of going out with the [[Trainer (umamusume)|]]), as a reference to one of the in-game events.

A common variation used by fans (but not in official media) is "onsen umapyoi", occasionally abbreviated to "onsenpyoi" (温泉ぴょい). This can refer to either: 1. to finish a given [[horse girl]]'s training scenario with the semi-secret hot spring event unlocked, which requires the player to randomly acquire the Hot Spring Tickets in that scenario and win the URA final, or 2. from the above, to "go all the way" at the hot spring [i]ryokan[/i] with a given girl (or, yet again, [[Kiryuin Aoi]]). 

Since the release of the Aoharu training mode, [[Kashimoto Riko]] has joined [[Kiryuin Aoi]] in the list of possible umapyoi-ees (or, alternatively, umapyoi-ers).

The song also features other 'nonsensical' portmanteau words such as [i]umadacchi[/i], [i]sukidacchi[/i] and [i]umapoi[/i] (without the 'y'), all of which are also co-opted by the fanbase for pretty much the same meanings as [i]umapyoi[/i] above. As such, these examples can also be tagged umapyoi.

Usage of all these four words has also spread to other fanbases.

This tag should generally not be used when the words occur as part of the [[Umapyoi Densetsu]] song, i.e. the characters are singing the song normally in their original context.

h4. Variations

* うまぴょい [tn]umapyoi, "horseyhop!"[/tn]
* うまだっち [tn]umadacchi, "horseypals!" or "horsey-stand-up!"[/tn]
* すきだっち [tn]sukidacchi, "likeypals!"[/tn]
* うまぽい [tn]umapoi, "horseytoss!"[/tn]
* 우마뾰이 [tn]"umapyoi" in Korean[/tn]

h4. Original song lyrics, first verse

[quote]
[tn]JP:[/tn]
うーーーー(うまだっち)
うーーー(うまぴょい うまぴょい)
うーー(すきだっち) うーー(うまぽい)
うまうまうみゃうみゃ 3 2 1 Fight！！

[tn]Transliteration:[/tn]
Uuuuuuuuu (Umadacchi!)
Uuuuuuu (Umapyoi Umapyoi!)
Uuuuu (Sukidacchi!) Uuuuu (Umapoi!)
Uma uma umya umya 3 2 1 Fight!!
[/quote]

h4. See also
* [[Umapyoi Densetsu]]
other_names: こいつらうまぴょいしたんだ!!
こいつらうまぴょいするんだ!

title: mark_grayson
body:
Mark Grayson, also known by his hero alias [[Invincible (character)|]], is the titular character of Robert Kirkman's [[Invincible (series)|]] comic series and Amazon's animated adaptation.
 
The son of the Viltrumite superhero [[Omni-man]] and his wife, the human woman [[Debbie Grayson]]. After Mark gains his powers at 17 years old, he discovers the harsh realities of being a superhero while struggling to define himself. He is shown to have a berserker side when fighting the Flaxans and Machine Head's villains, revealed to be a Viltrumite trait.

He is voiced by Steven Yeun in the Invincible animated series. Since Mark's voice actor is voiced by Korean-American actor Steven Yeun and his mother Debbie is voiced by Korean-Canadian actress Sandra Oh, Mark is portrayed as half-White, half-Korean in the series.

title: invincible_(series)
body:
Superhero comic series by Robert Kirkman and published by Image comics. 

An animated adaptation of the series premiered on Amazon Prime in 2021 to high praise, being renewed for two more seasons only a month after debut. 

The second season aired in two parts, the first part from November 3, 2023 to November 24, 2023 and the second part from March 14, 2024 to April 4, 2024. 

The third season aired in 2025 with a fourth season being scheduled to air in 2026.

h4. See also
* [[Think Mark Think! (meme)]]

title: spike_blop
body:
A variant of the [[Spiny]] from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that appears exclusively in [[Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story]]. Spike Blops attack by either shuffling towards or jumping from the ceiling onto the player. They cannot be jumped on, due to their [[spikes]] and can be countered with a [[hammer]].

Spike Blops are depicted as a teal, [[slime (creature)|]]-like creature that is protected with a [[spiked shell|spiked]] red [[turtle shell|shell]], resembling a Spiny shell.

title: super_crown
body:
An infamous powerup from [[New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe]] that transforms [[Toadette]] into [[Peachette]], a [[Princess Peach]] lookalike retaining some original form attributes, with Peach's abilities and more. Canonically, the game's official website states only she can use it.

Fans, however, used it to similarly transform [[Bowser]], and from there on [[King Boo]], then many more characters, and even [[personification|personify]] items, from the [[mario (series)|Mario universe]]. More specifically in human female, but no additional abilities. The more esoteric the subject, the less “lookalike” or even “human” applies.

The trend is known as “peachifying” (ピーチ姫化) in Japan. The result is typically named with either an "-ette" suffix (in reference to Peachette), or by default a “princess” title like Peach ("-Hime" suffix in Japanese).

h4. Tagging rules

According to topic #15603, peachifying is its own distinct change and resulting character:
* Don't tag the regular form character or [[Princess Peach]]. (post #3262233).
* Don't tag [[cosplay]]. (post #3262904)
* Tag [[transformation]] only if the change is shown or suggested. (post #3262233).
* Tag [[genderswap]] only if the change is shown or suggested, or the expected result is swapped. (post #3265315)
* Copyright tag with [[New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe]], not the origin of the character's regular form.
…unless otherwise also present caveat for all these rules.

title: pokey_(mario)
body:
A [[cactus]] enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared [[Yume Koujou: Doki Doki Panic]], then later incorporated into the Mario franchise proper with [[Super Mario Bros. 2]]. They are only found in [[desert]] levels and are covered with [[spikes]], damaging the player when touched. Hitting the head defeats the whole Pokey, although it is possible to knock away one of its segments (or have [[Yoshi]] eat it) without defeating it.

Pokeys are depicted as multi-segmented yellow [[cactus|cacti]] covered with [[spikes]] and are always [[smile|smiling]]. Some Pokeys may also have a [[flower]] on their head. They were green in their original design.

title: monty_mole
body:
A [[mole (animal)|]] enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario World]]. They dig underground and pop out of holes to quickly pursue the player and will sometimes throw rocks. Monty Moles also appear in [[Whac-A-Mole]] themed minigames throughout several games and are also playable characters in more recent [[Mario Kart]] and [[Mario Party]] games.

Monty Moles are depicted as a brown and white mole with long [[claws]], [[buck teeth]] and [[closed eyes]]. They wore [[sunglasses]] in their original design before being removed later on.

Spinys are depicted as a [[turtle]]-like enemy that is mostly yellow and have a red [[turtle shell|shell]] covered in [[spiked shell|spikes]].

title: javelin_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] destroyer HMS [i]Javelin[/i] (F61). The game officially renders her name as [i]Javerin[/i] (ジャヴェリン), although the spelling [i]Jaberin[/i] (ジャベリン) has also been referred to her and her various namesakes.

Javelin is dressed identically to her J-class sisters, with a white [[sailor dress]] under a black cropped blazer, [[white gloves]], a white [[sailor hat]], [[white socks]], and [[Mary Janes]]. Unlike her sisters, however, Javelin has long [[grey hair]] instead of blonde, and her [[rigging]] is a camouflage mix rather than straight grey.

title: janus_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] J-class destroyer HMS [i]Janus[/i] (F53). 
Character design by [[konishi_(koconatu)|Konishi]], voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

As a J-class, she is dressed and geared identically to [[Jervis (Kancolle)|]], the only difference being that she is [[left-handed]] and that her gear is always painted like Jervis Kai.

Like Jervis, she is also a [[blue_eyes|blue-eyed]] [[blonde_hair|blonde]], but her hairstyle is quite different: Medium-length hair curling and rolling inwards (making her look like she has shorter hair) along with [[parted bangs]], the right-side bangs also being feathered.

title: jervis_(kancolle)
body:
HMS [i]Jervis[/i], pennant number F00 from 1938 to 1940 and G00 during World War II, as depicted in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. Jervis is the game's first wartime Allied destroyer.

Jervis wears a white [[sailor dress]] with a black cropped blazer over it, [[white gloves]], a white [[sailor hat]], [[white socks]], and [[Mary Janes]]. Among her rigging are her three QF 4.7-inch Mark XII guns. She also holds a cannon gun. She can be distinguished from her sisters by her long [[blonde hair]].

title: imageboard_desourced
body:
From February of 2008 up to Late November of 2016, Danbooru rewrote select imageboard sources to "Image board" on upload, such as those from 4chan, Cynthia and Yande.re. Due to the nature of things, it is unlikely for those automatic changes to be reversed. (forum #122820)

As a result, post with such sources have automatically received the [[non-web source]] tag, due to their now-textual nature.

This tag is for such posts (as well as those posts that were manually desourced from their original by users uploading). If possible, the sources should be standardized for ease of access (forum #152518), if not restored if in any way possible. Posts which have had their sources changed to either their original first-party source, a different text source, or to nothing cannot reasonably be accounted for.

h4. Guidelines

* [[Bad ID]]'s guideline on when the source field can be changed apply here.
* If the source is changed to the image's original first-party source (resourcing), assuming the source in question is still active, and the md5/EXIF data might not match, please use topic #16765 to get the post replaced.
* For first-party sources that aren't available anymore ([[bad ID]]), check tools such as SauceNAO and ascii2d, as to see if a link to them can still be obtained (though in such a case, this tag could arguably be retained on the post in question, due to how imageboards can potentially change that data; or if not, substituted with [[MD5 mismatch]] where appropriate).
* Always compare when the Danbooru post was uploaded relative to the source that might be used for resourcing:
** Sources such as yande.re, Zerochan, et al can often postdate the Danbooru post by minutes or even months, despite having the same MD5 and not linking to Danbooru (an indication that they aren't the source, but rather got it from the same source Danbooru did, whether the same imageboard or even the same user);
** Some sources may not calculate time the same as Danbooru: Danbooru localizes to your local time, while for example yande.re uses UTC; so when comparing dates, always check whether they are in the same time zone.

h4. Example on how to search for such posts

* {{source:"*Image board*" -source:http*}}

h4. See also

* [[source request]]
* [[third-party source]]

title: bad_id
body:
A post that is no longer available from the source link. Usually this is because the work was deleted by the artist.

Compare with [[bad source]], where the link does not point to the original image, and [[bad link]], where the source is correct but it leads to a direct image instead of a proper post.

h4. Guidelines

If another source for the image is found, follow these instructions:

* If the filesize and MD5 hash are the same, then change the source field to the new source, and remove the [[bad id]] tag(s). The MD5 hash can be compared with http://onlinemd5.com/, https://md5file.com/calculator, or https://duplicatebooru.zipfiled.info/. Note: A source is legitimate only if it's hosted by the original artist.
* If the filesizes are different and the image is inferior, then just ignore it and do not upload it.
* If the filesizes are different and the image is superior, then upload it if you consider the image worthy, then parent the original to the upload (by clicking edit on the child post and pasting in the parent ID in the parent field) and then tag the original upload with the [[duplicate]] tag.

title: technoblade
body:
A [[Minecraft YouTube]]r, one of the most popular. He made content involving various PVP games demonstrating his skill in the game, and acquired a fanbase for his dry, snarky humor. He was a member of [[Dream SMP]], where he played the character of a militant anarchist fighting against tyranny, as well as [[Origins SMP]], where instead of his typical character, he played as a [[Technoblade (Bunny)|rabbit]] who was a carrot farmer.

He passed away from sarcoma in June 2022, but his legacy lives on in works created by his very passionate fans and charity work done by both his fans and co-workers in his honor.

Commonly associated with the phrases "Blood for the Blood God" and "Technoblade never dies". 

He is particularly popular on the Chinese internet, even moreso than other MCYT creators, and commonly has custom goods sold by artists there.

h4. Appearance

His character is most commonly depicted as a [[pig boy]], either [[furry]] or simply a humanoid with animal ears. He is often portrayed as an [[androgynous]] man with long [[pink hair]], typically worn in a [[braid]]. His outfit typically consists of a [[red cape]] with a [[fur trim]], a [[white shirt]], [[pants]], a [[crown]], and [[boots]].

In [[Dream SMP]] fanart, he is often depicted alongside multiple dogs, a [[wither skull]], or given a single [[crystal earrings|emerald earring]] that matches his best friend [[Ph1LzA]].

h5. Skins

* !asset #22469255: Default
* !asset #22469259: Arctic
* !asset #22469258: [[technoblade (bunny)|Origins SMP]]

h4. Related characters

title: yuki_miku_(2017)
body:
"Twinkle Snow ver."

The 2017 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme for the 2017 design contest was "Stars/constellations of winter Hokkaido", with the winning design by [[Nishina hima]].

Her fan nickname is "Twinkle-chan".

She has blue hair bows with [[stars|star hair ornaments]], a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress]] decorated with [[constellation print]], blue [[detached sleeves]], and mostly bare legs with a [[frilled thigh strap]]. She wields a [[conductor baton|music baton]] that acts as a magical [[wand]].

Her theme song is [[Star_Night_Snow_(Vocaloid)|Star Night Snow]] by Orangestar and nbuna.

title: lion_guardian_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Lion Guardians[/b] are strong enemies in [[Elden Ring]]. These giant, grey [[lion]]-like creatures have a thick white mane, jagged and broken [[horns]], and wield a large curved [[sword]] attached to one of their arms. They are agile and attack with powerful leaps and dive attacks. Those found at The Mountaintop of the Giants will also have a [[breathing ice|ice breath]] attack.

They are the inbred and malformed descendants of the Divine Beasts captured in the war against the [[Hornsent (elden ring)|]].

title: garfield_(character)
body: Created by Jim Davis and one of the most iconic comic strip characters in the West. Garfield is an orange, overweight tabby [[cat]] with an addiction to [[lasagna]] and a dry sense of humor. He is accompanied by his lonely owner, [[Jon Arbuckle]], and a dog, [[Odie (Garfield)|odie]] . In the late 2010s/early 2020s, various internet users would portray him as something significantly more eldritch, serving to perpetually torment Jon.

title: crotch_handshake_(meme)
body:
"Crotch Handshake" or "Friends Shaking Hands Through Pants Zipper" refers to an exploitable image of two boys in a school hallway shaking hands through each other's pants zippers while staring directly at the camera.

h4. External links
* "Imgur: When you love and respect each other.":[https://imgur.com/gallery/when-you-love-respect-each-other-UDbEILQ]

title: odie_(garfield)
body: Character from [[Garfield]], Odie is a yellow-furred, brown-eared [[dog]] described by Garfield to be a "purebred clown" and possibly a dachshund in the live-action movies that resides with Jon and Garfield and is, at times, Garfield's best friend. The name came from a commercial written by Davis, which featured Odie the Village Idiot. Davis liked the name and reused it. Odie's main characteristic is his general "lack of intelligence and naiveté", which allows for Garfield to triumph over him in their prankings.

title: the_simpsons
body:
A very popular and long lasting animated comedy TV show created by cartoonist Matthew Groening. The series is a satirical depiction of [[united_states|American]] life.

Since its debut on December 17, 1989, over 700 episodes of the show have been broadcast. It is the longest-running American animated series, longest-running American sitcom, and the longest-running American scripted primetime television series, both in terms of seasons and number of episodes.

For works done in the style of The Simpsons, tag as [[matt groening (style)]].

title: bobby_hill
body:
Robert Jeffrey "Bobby" Hill (born August 13, 1985) is a
