title: about:userscripts
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
1. "Intro":#dtext-intro
2. "Bookmarklets":#dtext-bookmarklets
3. "Scripts":#dtext-scripts
4. "How to use":#dtext-how-to-use
5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

h4#intro. Intro

Various userscripts exist to improve your experience using Danbooru and related sites.

h4#bookmarklets. Bookmarklets

* "Post/Batch to Danbooru":[/static/bookmarklet] - Automagically populates the image, source, artist and tags for various image source sites. See topic #14119 for the full list of support.
* "Goto Pixiv/Twitter/Nicoseiga/Deviantart/Pawoo/Nijie":[/forum_posts/132578] - Go directly to a post using only the post ID.
* "Enable/Disable Embedded Notes":[/forum_posts/136193] - Provides the ability to change the embedded mode of notes used on a post.  With embedded notes enabled, the text becomes visible without needing to hover over the text box. See topic #11337.
* "Clean Post URLs":[/forum_posts/136251]: Removes trailing search parameters on image links from the post search page so that maintaining bookmarks is easier.
* "Switch Danbooru domain":[/forum_posts/142450]: Provides a mechanism to quickly switch between Danbooru's subdomains.
* "Switch safe mode":[/forum_posts/220485]: Switches the safe mode on or off.
* "Set color theme":[/forum_posts/220485]: Sets the color theme at auto, light, or dark.
** "Updated color theme switcher":[/forum_posts/232433]: Isn't separated, but doesn't do auto.

[tn][b]Note:[/b]  Bookmarklets are normally disabled on certain sites like Twitter using the Firefox web browser.  In order to use any of the above bookmarklets from those sites, install and use the Firefox addon "Bookmarklets Context Menu":[https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/bookmarklets-context-menu/].[/tn]

h4#scripts. Scripts

h5. Danbooru

h6. User interface

* "Miscellaneous Tweaks":[https://sleazyfork.org/scripts/3467] - Adds an assortment of mostly-independent tweaks to Danbooru.  Settings are changed by clicking the "Tweaks" link inserted into the navbar.
* "Danbooru 2 Tweaks":http://userscripts-mirror.org/scripts/show/160157 - Another script with assorted changes.  Settings are changed by modifying the top of the script.
* "Danbooru 2 Tweaks & Features":https://github.com/Lightforger/danbooru-userscript/ - See topic #9023
* "Danbooru EX":[/forum_topics/13167]: Adds a variety of tweaks and new features. See https://github.com/evazion/danbooru-ex for an overview.
* "Better Better Booru":[https://github.com/pseudonymous/better-better-booru]: Various tweaks to make Danbooru better.
* "Danbooru FOF":[https://github.com/reiyasona/danbooru.user.js] ("install":[https://github.com/reiyasona/danbooru.user.js/raw/master/scripts/danbooru_fof/danbooru_fof.user.js]): User script that slightly fades out your favourites.
* "DTextStyler":[/forum_topics/14229]:  Adds controls to the top of the textbox that assists with the [[help:dtext|DText]] style markup Danbooru uses.
* "SiteTagSearches":[/forum_topics/14958]:  Adds many more site links beyond the standard Pixiv links on wiki page entries.  For tag links, it has [b]Gelbooru[/b], [b]Yandere[/b], [b]Sankaku[/b], and [b]Konachan[/b].  For other links ([tn]which includes other languages like Japanese[/tn]), it has [b]Pixiv[/b], [b]Nicoseiga[/b], [b]Nijie[/b], [b]Tinami[/b], [b]BCY.net[/b], [b]Deviantart[/b], [b]Artstation[/b], [b]Tumblr[/b], [b]Twitter[/b], and [b]E-Hentai[/b].
* "EventListener":[/forum_topics/14747]:  Checks frequently for new events of interest. This includes [b]flags[/b], [b]appeals[/b], new [b]dmails[/b] or [b]spam[/b], [b]comments[/b], [b]notes[/b], [b]artist commentaries[/b], [b]post edits[/b], [b]post approvals[/b], [b]pools[/b], [b]wiki pages[/b], [b]forum posts[/b], [b]bans[/b], [b]user feedback[/b], [b]mod actions[/b].
* "CurrentUploads":[/forum_topics/15169]:  Checks the upload count from the last 24 hours for any user plus the copyrights they've uploaded, and offers statistics and various other time periods for comparison. This helps with upload pacing and variety.
* "DisplayPostInfo":[/forum_topics/15926]: Displays the uploader, top tagger, and post views on a post.
* "Safelist Plus":[/forum_topics/14221]: Alternate blacklist handler, with changing between multiple blacklists supported. Also has a mechanism to change CSS styles, which can be used with a blacklist or standalone.
* "TranslatorAssist":[/forum_topics/20687]: User interface to assist a translator on Danbooru. Also includes background functions to check for recent/new noters on a post.
* "Wiki Card":[/forum_topics/8502?page=7#forum_post_241589]: Adds a wiki viewer to the uploading and tag editing forms.
* "Panzoom":[/forum_posts/236266]: Adds image pan and zoom to the upload page and media asset page.
* "Universal Booru Image Comparator":[/forum_posts/371051]: Compare images on Danbooru / Yande.re / Konachan with multiple modes and transformations.
* "More Tooltips":[/forum_posts/343102]: Show tooltips when hovering over artist, media asset or favorite group links.
* "Danbooru Artist Tweaks":[/forum_posts/374786]: Add Create wiki link for artist pages without wiki page and copy artist name button.

h6. Functional

* "Unlimited Paginator Works":[https://sleazyfork.org/scripts/5250] - Loads subsequent pages of various searches on various *boorus as you scroll down.  It supports six sites by default and is supposed to work pretty well on similar sites after you add them to the includes list.
* "Note assist":https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Lightforger/Note-Assist/master/Note-Assist.user.js - Userscript designed to make translating easier and faster by automatically resizing or creating the notes for you.  See that page or topic #9373 for more information.
* "ValidateTagInput":[/forum_topics/14474]: Checks all tag adds and removals on uploads or post edits, and warns the user about adding nonexistent tags or being unable to remove a tag due to an implication.
* "IndexedAutocomplete":[/forum_topics/14701]:  On average increases the speed of autocomplete by using an alternate storage mechanism.  It also adds additional autocomplete in various places where it currently enabled.
* "RecentTagsCalc":[/forum_topics/15851]: Replaces the existing recent tags when editing/uploading a post with using alternate schemes of collecting and displaying recently used tags.
* "Refined Danbooru":[https://github.com/kidonng/cherry/tree/main/scripts#refined-danbooru] - more keyboard shortcuts, add toggles for tag groups and more.
* "Blacklist2":[/forum_posts/255401]: Adds full search query support and partial metatag support to blacklists.
* "Hide Uploads":[https://files.catbox.moe/nk1fbv.js]: Allows hiding posts from the "My Uploads" tab. Toggling "Show hidden" will reveal hidden items.
* "Danbooru tag input remapper":[https://gist.githubusercontent.com/HyphenSam/bd1ed0924fe1f95d5fad5fcfac997b0f/raw/687c06727df75cfc7911cd88d237a4cda41fd5cb/Danbooru_tag_input_remapper.js]: Allows for remapping of keyboard inputs when tagging.
* "Banned Posts Helper":[/forum_posts/312212]: Shows as much banned post content as possible for users below level 37.

h5. External sites

* "Cleared Pixiv Artists":[https://sleazyfork.org/en/scripts/3634] - Lets you keep track of pixiv artists you intend to look over later and get randomly sent to one of them. 
* "Pixiv Translation Plus":http://userscripts-mirror.org/scripts/show/65644 - Translates the Pixiv interface and some tags.  You have the ability to add your own custom translations (which override the defaults).
* "Pixiv Image Searches and Stuff (PISAS)":https://github.com/nottalulah/userscripts/raw/master/Pixiv_Image_Searches_and_Stuff.user.js - Searches Danbooru for pixiv IDs, adds IQDB links, and filters thumbs based on number of favorites (first two are disabled by default).
* "Pixiv Infinite Scroll/Animation Download Links":https://greasyfork.org/scripts/3091 - Infinite scroll + Inline image/manga expansion + Animation .zip download links (including timing information for animation frames)
* "Pixiv Direct Links":https://greasyfork.org/scripts/4555 - Turns thumbnail titles into direct or mode=manga links, adds direct image links on mode=manga pages, replaces the medium thumbnail on mode=medium pages with the full size, and disables lazy-loading images. 
* "Translate Pixiv Tags":[/forum_topics/14673]: Translates tags on [b]Pixiv[/b], [b]Nijie[/b], [b]NicoSeiga[/b], [b]Tinami[/b], and [b]BCY[/b] to [b]Danbooru[/b] tags. Additionally it looks up the tag used for an artist.
* "IQDBBooru":[/forum_topics/14450]:  Adds a link when a tag search is performed, which when clicked will check every thumbnail against Danbooru's IQDB database and highlights hits and misses.  Currently supports [b]Gelbooru[/b], [b]Yandere[/b], [b]Konachan[/b], [b]Sankaku[/b].
* "IQDB4chan":[/forum_topics/14420]:  Adds a link on the threads of image boards, which when clicked will check every thumbnail against Danbooru's IQDB database and highlights hits and misses.
* "New Twitter Image Searches and Stuff":[/forum_topics/16342] (NTISAS):   Based off the same concept as PISAS, it helps identify already uploaded images on Twitter, and provides a mechanism for highlighting and filtering tweets based upon the favorite score, along with several other user interface enhancements.
* "DeviantArt Base36 Auto Converter":[/forum_posts/371049]: Automatically converts DeviantArt "/view/c/[base36]" URLs to "/view/[base10]" format. Useful for sourcing images when you have saved filenames containing base36 IDs.

h4#how-to-use. How to use

h5. Bookmarklets

1. Right-click on bookmarks bar
2a. (Chrome) Add page
2b. (Firefox) Add bookmark
1. Add description to [b]Name[/b] field
2. Copy bookmarklet text and add to the [b]URL[/b] field

To activate the bookmarklet, just click the bookmark link.

h5. Scripts

1. Install a userscript extension
** https://tampermonkey.net
** https://violentmonkey.github.io
2. Click userscript install link
** Should end with the [code]user.js[/code] file extension
3. At the prompt, click install

If you don't get a prompt, try the additional following steps.

4. Open userscript manager dashboard by left clicking the icon in the bar
5. Click the + icon to create a new script
6. Copy/paste the userscript text into the text area
7. Save the script using the controls at the top of the text area or by using Ctrl + S

Once the script is saved, it will automatically activate on the pages it is allowed to run on. Sometimes there are issues with it loading after the initial install, which are usually resolved by restarting the browser.

h4#see-also. See also

* topic #8502 (general discussion)

h4#external-links. External links

* [b]Scripts[/b]
** http://wiki.greasespot.net/User_script
* [b]Script managers[/b]
** https://tampermonkey.net
** https://violentmonkey.github.io

title: no_game_no_life
body:
An ongoing 2012 light novel series written and illustrated by [[Kamiya Yuu]] (a pseudonym for Brazilian-Japanese Thiago Furukawa Lucas), published under Media Factory's "MF Bunko J" imprint. The series was also adapted into a manga, running since 2013, illustrated by [[Hiiragi Mashiro]], an anime series by Madhouse that aired Spring season 2014, and an anime film that was released in 2017.

h4. Synopsis
18-year-old [[Sora (no_game_no_life)|]] and his 11-year-old stepsister [[Shiro_(no_game_no_life)|]] are a pair of [[neet|shut]][[hikikomori|-ins]] and gamers under the collective account of "『  』" ("Kuuhaku"; lit., a blank space), legendary for winning every game they play, who are also disillusioned with society.

Their lives are changed when they are summoned to Disboard, a world where violence is banned and all disputes are settled with games, by its androgynous deity, [[teto_(no_game_no_life)|Teto]]. Deciding to settle in, the pair began representing humans, ranked last among the sixteen sentient races of Disboard, together with its former princess, [[Stephanie Dora]], in order to reclaim lost lands as well as their power.


h4. Characters
* [[Sora (no game no life)|]]

body:

Hashida has brown hair and [[glasses]] and is seen often sporting a [[green shirt]] and yellow ballcap. He is canonically portly. He is an [[otaku]]
Also known as Daru (ダル).

title: shiina_mayuri
body:
A main character in [[Steins;Gate]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[green_eyes|greenish]] [[blue eyes]].

She typically wears a [[short_dress|short]] [[blue dress]] with a [[blue_bow|blue]] [[dress_bow|bow]] and [[puffy short sleeves]], with [[denim shorts]] underneath. She also wears a [[blue_headwear|blue]] [[frilled hat]] with [[blue_bow|blue]] [[hat_bow|bows]].

In [[Steins;Gate 0]], she wears a [[white_headwear|white]] [[hat]] and a [[pink capelet]]. 

Also known as Mayushii (まゆしぃ).
Her catch phrase is Tutturu (トゥットゥル).

title: okabe_rintarou
body:
The protagonist of [[Steins;Gate]] and [[Steins;Gate 0]].
Also known as Hououin Kyouma (鳳凰院 凶真) and Okarin (オカリン).

He has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. 

In [[Steins;Gate]], he wears a [[white shirt]], [[brown pants]], and a [[lab coat]] with a red [[pen]] in its [[breast pocket]]. 

In [[Steins;Gate 0]], he instead wears a [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[black shirt]], [[black pants]] and a [[black coat]] with the red [[pen]] still in the [[breast pocket]].

Despite his [[chuunibyou|goofiness]], he's actually pretty intelligent and has an intuitive grasp of much of what they're doing.

title: revealing_clothes
body:
A shameless and impractical set of clothes that do not leave much to the imagination when worn. With some designs, the wearer may as well be [[nude]] for all the cover they provide. 

This doesn't include [[lingerie]], [[swimsuit]]s, [[bikini armor]], [[harem outfit]]s or other common types of clothing that are expected to be revealing. Likewise, [[torn clothes]], [[wet clothes]], [[dissolving clothes]] or other external events that cause partial nudity don't count either because the revealing elements are accidental.

Revealing clothes are intentionally designed to be showy and not for real-world functionality - they only exist to show off as much of the body as possible while providing minimal coverage. Common elements include [[see-through clothes]], [[miniskirt]]s or [[microskirt]]s, [[thong]]s, [[bikini_top_only|bikini tops]], [[cleavage cutout]]s, [[breast curtains]], [[sideboob]] or [[underboob]] revealing tops, and a distinct lack of [[bra]]s and [[panties]]. [[Thighhighs]] are also popular to show off the thighs with [[zettai ryouiki]].

h4. Examples

* [[Aoba Anoa]], [[Diol Twee]], etc. ([[Otomedius]])
* [[destiny (ishida)|Destiny]] ([[Ishida Hiroyuki]]'s [[original]] character)
* [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]] and [[Ramlethal Valentine]] ([[Guilty Gear]])
* [[Makoto Nanaya]], [[Mai Natsume]] and [[Mu-12]] ([[Blazblue]])
* [[Matoi Ryuuko]], [[Kiryuuin Satsuki]], and anyone wearing a [[Nudist Beach uniform]] ([[Kill La Kill]])
* [[boudica (fate)|Boudica]], [[meltryllis (fate)|Meltryllis]], [[shuten douji (fate)|Shuten Douji]] and [[ushiwakamaru (fate)|Ushiwakamaru]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
* [[Porno Dianno]] ([[Bastard!!]])
* [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]] ([[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]])
* [[Echidna (queen's blade)|]], [[Menace (queen's blade)|]], and several characters from [[Queen's Blade]]
* [[Camilla (Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])

The Command Spell can be used by the Master to force the Servant to perform any actions they wanted, even if it's [[body control|against their will]], such as forcing them to commit suicide.

title: tales_of_legendia
body:
The seventh mothership title for the [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series developed by Namco for the Playstation 2. It was localized to America, and is the first of two titles to not have character designs done by Inomata Mutsumi or Fujishima Kousuke (the other being [[Okumura Daigo]] for [[Tales of Xillia 2]]). Instead, Legendia's artwork is done by Nakazawa Kazuto. While the story is praised, the battle system does not offer anything unique in 2D battle standards except the Climax system.

title: bunker_hill_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the aircraft carrier USS [i]Bunker Hill[/i] (CV-17). Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Ichinose Kana]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[black rose]] [[hair flower]] adorning the right side of her hair. Her uniform is near identical to [[Essex (Azur Lane)|Essex]]. She wears a low cut [[blue dress]] with red and white accents as well as her name written vertically along the left side. She has a [[blue cloak]] with a closed [[high collar]] as well as a [[red necktie]]. She wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[black footwear]] [[boots]].

Her [[rigging]] is an asymmetrical pair of [[flight deck|flight decks]]. On her right is the longer flight deck which splits width-wise, about two-thirds from the stern, as well as a hull. On her left is the short flight deck which is marked with the number 17.

title: collective_shout
body:
Collective Shout is an Australian activist group that advocates against the objectification of women and the sexualization of girls in media, advertising, and popular culture. 

In July 2025, the group got worldwide attention after successfully lobbying against the digital distribution platforms Steam and Itch.io, by targeting payment processors like Paypal, Visa, and Mastercard and calling on them to stop processing payments for these platforms through an "open letter":[https://www.collectiveshout.org/open-letter-to-payment-processors].
This resulted in a large number of games being removed from these platforms and changes to the rules regarding allowed content.

h4. Logo
* !asset #30090839

h4. External links:
* "Homepage":[https://www.collectiveshout.org/]

title: chaldea_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by members of the [[Chaldea Security Organization]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

There are many variants of the uniform, depending on the rank and position the member is. [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|Male Ritsuka]] and [[fujimaru ritsuka (female)|Female Ritsuka]] wear a white shirt with black buckles on the chest, with the male uniform having [[black pants]] and the female uniform having a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]]. [[Romani Archaman]] wears a doctor's uniform beneath a white coat. Other staff members like [[Jingle Abel Meuniere]] and [[Sylvia (fate)|]] wear a black shirt with the secondary color being different depending on the gender - orange for women, and aqua for men - and either [[white pants]] or a [[white skirt]]. 

[[Dark Young (fate)|]] has the same coloration as the protagonists' Chaldea uniforms.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25932608: Female uniform

title: they_(zelda)
body: An enigmatic alien-like enemy in [[The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask]]. Resembling traditional depictions of the [[Flatwoods Monster]], they appear at night to abduct the cows of Romani Ranch. If [[Link]] fails to defeat them, they will also end up abducting [[Romani (Zelda)|]]. She ends up being sent back the following day in a catatonic state.

title: majora_(entity)
body:
Main villain of [[The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask|Majora's Mask]]. Majora is an ancient primordial deity who was at some point in the past sealed into the form of a [[mask]]. The mask gradually corrupts its wearer, eventually allowing Majora to take control of the wearer as its puppet, as seen with the [[Skull Kid]]. An insane and evil being, it sealed the [[four giants]] and intends to have Termina's [[Moon (Zelda)|]] collide with and destroy the world.

h4. Forms

* [[Majora's Incarnation]]
* [[Majora's Wrath]]

title: 300_(movie)
body:
A 1998 American comic series by Frank Miller, later adapted into a 2007 movie by [[Zack Snyder]]; a fictional, fantasy-like retelling of the last stand of 300 Spartan [[hoplite]] warriors against an invading force of over a million [[Persia]]ns at the mountain pass of Thermopylae in central [[Greece]]. Best known for a scene in which the leader of the Spartans, [[Leonidas I]], tells off a Persian messenger with the iconic words "[[This is SPARTA (meme)|]]", before throwing him down a well.

While the movie was a commercial success, it was generally disliked by Greeks and Iranians for the bastardization of their historical figures of each respective sides, along with numerous other historical inaccuracies.

The movie would later have a sequel in 2014, [b]300: Rise of an Empire[/b], based on Frank Miller's then unpublished prequel comic, [i]Xerxes[/i], which would not be released until 2018. Serving as a prequel, side-story and sequel to the original movie, Rise of an Empire focusses on Emperor Xerxes past and the Athenians led by General Themistocles as they battle the Persian Navy at sea.

h4. See also

* [[Aspis]]
* [[Xiphos]]
* [[Oracle (Ancient Greece)]]
* [[Phalanx]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 300 (film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/300_(film)

title: naomi_bluebird
body:
Main character of the animated series [[We Love Cold War]] by independent animator [[Nico Jiang]]. While they go by different pseudonyms through the course of the series (most prominently: Naomi Kennedy), their first name and codename, referring to their hair color, remain consistent.

An American CIA Peace Corps agent (unrelated to the real world CIA despite having the same name), has [[blue hair]], [[orange-tinted eyewear|orange]] [[aviator sunglasses]], and a [[hair bun]]. Any art without these canonical character traits are mostly considered to be unofficial and unrelated to the WLCW IP.

title: alien_stage
body:
A web animation series by [[VIVINOS]] and [[Qmeng]].

Alien Stage, a reality audition program, has taken the alien world by storm, and its upcoming season is planned to be just as exciting. Contestants must sing for their survival, as the loser faces on-the-spot termination. As the competition heats up, a mysterious girl emerges, whose involvement may hold the key to humanity's fate...

title: fox_platoon_(blue_archive)
body: The FOX Platoon, or FOX Squad in the Global version, was an elite military force under the SRT Special Academy. After the school's dissolution, the FOX Platoon went rogue and now opposes the General Student Council, their former superiors. Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus. h4. Members * [[yukino (blue archive)|Shichido Yukino]] * [[niko (blue archive)|Niko]] * [[kurumi (blue archive)|Kurumi]] * [[otogi (blue archive)|Otogi]] [tn]As of writing, the other three members have unknown family names.[/tn]

title: rabbit_platoon_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], RABBIT Platoon is one of the clubs at SRT Special Academy. It consists of [[Miyako (blue archive)|]], [[Saki (blue archive)|]], [[Miyu (blue archive)|]], and [[Moe (blue archive)|]].

A platoon of four freshmen students. In protest of the closure of SRT, they occupied Kousagi Park, where they staged a demonstration and repelled attempts by Valkyrie Police Academy to detain them until [[Sensei (blue archive)|]]'s arrival. After their release, they returned to Kousagi Park and began [s]being homeless[/s] camping there under Sensei's suggestions, living off of the park's free amenities and objects to be disposed, such as expired bentos from Angel 24 and oil barrels.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

* [[Miyako (blue archive)|]]
* [[Saki (blue archive)|]]
* [[Miyu (blue archive)|]]
* [[Moe (blue archive)|]]

title: moe_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of SRT Special Academy's [[RABBIT Platoon (blue archive)|]].

She has [[large breasts]] and [[yellow eyes]] with [[light brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]].  She wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]]. In her default outfit she wears a large [[blue sweater]] and [[pantyhose]]. She uses an MTE .224 [[handgun]].

Her full name is Kazekura Moe.

Voiced by: [[Izawa Shiori]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6496332: Default
* !post #7815894: [[Moe (Swimsuit) (Blue Archive)|Swimsuit]]
* !post #6703464: [[Angel's 24 Uniform (blue archive)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Angel's 24 Uniform (blue archive)|]]
* [[Rabbit Platoon (blue archive)|]]

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Moe":[https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Moe]

title: miyako_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Leader of SRT Special Academy's [[RABBIT Platoon (blue archive)|]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] worn with [[one side up]]. In her default outfit she wears a [[blue serafuku]] and [[rabbit ear headphones]]. She uses a modernized [[Suomi KP/-31]] [[submachine gun]].

Her full name is Tsukiyuki Miyako.

title: game_development_department_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], Game Development Department is one of the clubs at Millennium Science School.

In contrast to their school's motto, this Department is focused on making retro-styled games; one can mistake it for a typical gaming club.

This club is the main focus of the Millennium Arc, Clockwork Flower Pavane. During the arc, the club is in danger of being dissolved due to A.) only having three members and B.) not having made any notable accomplishments throughout the school year. They often clash with [[Yuuka (blue archive)|]] due to the club's issues.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

title: mg08/18
body:
The MG08/18 was an attempt by the [[Imperial German army]] at creating a true [[light machine gun]] from the [[MG08]] HMG, after their initial attempt the [[MG08/15]] fell short. The MG08/18 can be easily distinguished from the other models by its complete lack of a water cooling jacket around the barrel, turning the weapon into an air-cooled gun. 

Despite these efforts, weight savings were minimal over the MG08/15, as the [[Maxim gun]] operation put a hard limit on how much weight could be removed. A few hundred examples were produced and used in the last months of [[World War I]], but altogether the attempt was judged to be unsuccessful, though the later [[MG34]] did incorporate a similarly designed barrel assembly to the MG08/18.

The weapon is most famous for its inclusion in the video game [[Battlefield 1]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: MG 08":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_08]

title: mg08/15
body:
The MG08/15 was an [[Imperial German army]] development to create a [[light machine gun]] from the proven design of the [[MG08]] heavy machine gun. It was the most common German machine gun deployed during [[World War I]], and can be easily distinguished from the standard MG08 by its narrowed cooling jacket, "stepped down" receiver, and attachment of a [[bipod]], wooden stock, and pistol grip. 

Despite these efforts, the MG08/15's [[Maxim gun]] heritage made true weight savings difficult, and the machine gun remained extremely heavy for its intended role. The German army made a further attempt later in the war to shave weight down further, resulting in the air-cooled [[MG08/18]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: MG 08":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_08]

title: hilichurl_rogue_(genshin_impact)
body:
An enemy from [[Genshin Impact]].

Hilichurl Rogues are wanderer [[Hilichurl (genshin impact)|]]s that aren't affiliated with any tribe, preferring to live in solitary. They are much larger than regular Hilichurls, being similar in size to [[Mitachurl (genshin impact)|]] and take on the color of their element. They deal elemental damage and can summon [[slime (genshin impact)|]]s of their corresponding element in combat.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29696694: Hydro

h4. See also

* [[Caterpillar (genshin impact)|]]

title: hilichurl_(genshin_impact)
body:
An enemy group from [[Genshin Impact]]. Hilichurls are a [[goblin]]-like family of [[monster]]s that are one of the first enemies encountered in-game. 

Regardless of their growth stage, all Hilichurls have a fluffy [[mane]] with two long ears and always wear a [[loincloth]] and a [[mask]] to hide their face. Hilichurls that are afflicted with an element will take on that element's color. As a Hilichurl grows and survives, they eventually turn into [[Mitachurl (genshin impact)|]]s. Mitachurls that continue to grow and absorb elemental energy will turn into [[Lawachurl (genshin impact)|]]s.

Most Hilichurls live in tribes which are usually led by [[Samachurl (genshin impact)|]]s, although many are also affilliated with the Abyss Order as they are easily manipulated by [[Abyss Mage (genshin impact)|]]s. Hilichurls are quite intelligent, as they can use tools and [[Slime (genshin impact)|]]s, raise livestock and even communicate through their own language, Hilichurlian.

[spoiler]Hilichurls were actually once humans, notably Khaenri'ans, who were cursed by the Gods for "sinning", being granted a curse known as the "curse of the wilderness". This curse causes the person to transform into a monster, with their intelligence and behavior gradually degrading. They also slowly lose memories of their former life, although they still retain some self-awarness and emotion. Hilichurls recall what it was like to have a human face, so they wear masks to prevent the anguish of seeing their true faces.[/spoiler]

This tag includes all types of Hilichurls.

h4. Types

title: g5_iguazu_(armored_core_vi)
body:
A NPC acting as the player's rival <spoilers>and later on a recurring antagonist</spoilers> in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A 4th gen augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G5 (Pronounced 'Gun 5') Iguazu, referring to the Iguazu river/waterfall in Brazil and Argentina, South America. He pilots the AC '[[head bringer (armored core vi)|Head Bringer]]'<spoilers>, AC '[[Mind Gamma (Armored Core Vi)|]]' and a [[mecha]] simply named [[ALLMIND (sol 644)|]], a modified [[sol_644|SOL 644]] with ALLMIND markings</spoilers>.

There is no canon depiction of Iguazu in game save one line of text suggesting his face was [[scar on face|scarred]]/[[disfigured]] as a result of a fist-fight. Because of his callsign, he may be depicted with Latin-American ethnicity, or [[animalization|animalized]] as an [[iguana]].

Voiced by: Griffin Burns (EN), Tsuchida Hiroshi (JP)

title: oda_nobunaga_(koha-ace)
body:
The Archer-class servant of [[Saber (fate)|Artoria]] from the Type-Moon parody work [[Koha-Ace]], originally appearing under the alias "Demon Archer". She also appears as a playable servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] and as the servant of [[Asama Kaname]] in [[Fate/type Redline]].

Her Noble Phantasm is Three Thousand Worlds, a barrage of shots from the many muskets she used that gained her the title of "Devil King of Sixth Heaven".

This tag is for her costume introduced in [[Koha-Ace]]. If she's wearing a different costume, do not use this tag.

title: oda_nobunaga_(swimsuit_berserker)_(fate)
body:
[[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|Oda Nobunaga]] as a Berserker-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], debuting in the 2017 Summer event. Her weapon looks like an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[guitar]], owing to her moniker as the Dai[b]ROCK[/b]uten Maoh, and her Noble Phantasm is [b]NOBUNAGA THE ROCK'N ROLL[/b]. She wears a pair of [[headphones]] [[headphones around neck|around her neck]] in all ascensions.

As an aside, much like [[Elizabeth Bathory (Brave) (Fate)|Brave Liz]], a lot of her attacks contain references to other media, such as [[Hokuto no Ken]] and [[Dragon Ball]].

Do not tag Nobunaga Swimsuit Berserker as [[Oda Nobunaga (Koha-Ace)]], as they are treated as separate characters. Only tag them together if they are both present in the image, or one is [[cosplay]]ing as the other.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[pako (pakosun)|]]

title: conejo-ess
body:
Conejo-ess is a cosmic entity know as a Rabbitmaiden. She resides on Earth's moon, giving birth to millions of rabbits.

Conejo-ess's first appearance was in [[8eyes]] as a mother/deity worshipped by the main characters. [spoiler]In [[HEARTLOVEPOWERTEMPLE]], it is revealed that she began as a priestess named [[Conja]] and was ascended to Rabbitmaiden status with help from even greater deities known as Megamaidens.[/spoiler]

Conejo-ess can be differentiated from her counterpart by her longer [[twin drills]], [[antenna hair]], and [[giant]] size. She can also be identified by her clothes, including a yellow dress in [[HEARTLOVEPOWERTEMPLE]] and nothing but a white loincloth in [[8eyes]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29847351: [[Conejo-ess]][br][[HEARTLOVEPOWERTEMPLE]]

title: conja
body:
The main character of [[HEARTLOVEPOWERTEMPLE]]. She is a Lovemaiden, a psychic priestess that worships planet Venus's giant bleeding heart in the sky. She lives in a temple on Venus with three other Lovemaidens named [[Teja]], [[Iroja]], and [[Faroja]], and a Templemaiden named [[Mioja]].

[spoiler]At the end of [[HEARTLOVEPOWERTEMPLE]], Conja and her fellow Lovemaidens are ascended to the status of Rabbitmaiden, a type of powerful cosmic entity that is connected to a celestial body. Conja's Rabbitmaiden form is called [[Conejo-ess]] and resides on the Earth's moon.[/spoiler]

title: sol_644
body: IB-07: SOL 644 An end boss of [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An unmanned bipedal mech developed by the Rubicon Research Institute as part of their Ibis series of C-weapons, making full use of Coral-powered system for offense, defense and utility. Outfitted with four pairs of double barrelled Coral homing launchers (2x [[shoulder cannon|shoulder mount]] and 2x wrist mount), Coral [[energy sword]] and a Coral rifle. Its manoeuvrability rivals that of [[CEL 240]], its offensive capability rivals and possibly exceeding that of [[HAL 826]]. Though it is developed as an unmanned C-weapon, it was piloted by [[Ayre (armored core vi)|]] in the route 'Fires of Raven', serving as her mean to fight the player character [[621 (armored core vi)|C4 621]] and stop the colony ship Xylem, in the bid to save both her kins and the planet Rubicon III. In the 'Alea Iacta Est' route, the SOL 644 is modified, for joint operation by [[ALLMIND (armored core vi)|]] and [[G5 Iguazu (armored core vi)|]]. This modified SOL 644, simply called [[Allmind (Sol 644)|ALLMIND]] , is black in appearance, and uses green pulse energy instead of Coral. It is armed with green energy swords that can transform into [[energy claws]].

title: tales_of_phantasia
body:
The first game of the [b][i][[tales of (series)|Tales Series]][/i][/b] line.  Initially released on the [[super nintendo|Super Famicom]] in 1995, it has been ported and updated on several consoles, the latest being in conjunction with [[Tales of Phantasia: Narikiri Dungeon X]] for the [[Playstation Portable]]. It was finally localized in 2006 on the [[Game Boy Advance]], with dubious results. It also has fan translations for the Super Famicom and [[Playstation 1|PSX]] versions.

title: tales_of_rebirth
body:
The sixth mothership title for Namco's [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series released for the Playstation 2 and rereleased for the Playstation Portable. It was never localized to the West. Tales of Rebirth utilizes the Three-Line Linear Motion Battle System, which tweaks the traditional 2D field by dividing it into three lines. Also notable for the notorious "CLAAAAIRE!!" meme, which even the developers have incorporated into side material whenever Veigue appears.

body:

For Danbooru purposes a backbend can be any position involving bending of the back requiring slightly higher-than-average back [[flexible|flexibility]].

body: A pose that [[Tenkyuu Chimata]] does in her official art in [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. She has one finger [[pointing up]] at the sky, and the other finger [[pointing down]] at the ground. Her arms are also bent to give the overall appearance of an S shape. Ideally you want to see both hands to determine if she’s doing the pose, but it’s fine if one hand is clearly referencing it.

title: head_bringer_(armored_core_vi)
body:
The AC piloted by [[g5 Iguazu (armored core 6)|G5 Iguazu]] in  [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A bipedal AC made up entirely of the Balam produced 'Melander C3' parts and Dafeng produced internal combustion generator. Armaments include a [[submachine gun|light MG]] 'Ludlow', linear rifle 'Curtis', a shoulder pulse shield, and a shoulder mounted [[missile pod]]. Painted in teal, grey and maroon red.

Later in the game, some parts are swapped out: its arms became 'Mind Alpha' frame and the pulse shield became laser [[drone|orbit]]. Curiously, both are produced by [[ALLMIND (Armored Core Vi)|]].

title: shrek_1
body:
The first movie in the [[Shrek (series)|]] film series.
In the film, an embittered [[ogre]] named [[Shrek]] finds his home in the swamp overrun by fairy tale creatures banished by the obsessive ruler Lord Farquaad. With the help of Donkey, Shrek makes a pact with Farquaad to rescue Princess Fiona in exchange for regaining control of his swamp.

title: newtype_flash
body:
A common visual effect across the [[Gundam]] franchise. The newtype flash is a brief but strong surge of newtype power that usually warns the newtype towards danger, something helpful, an ally or someone in need.

The stock sound effect used for the Newtype Flash is based off the flexatone instrument.

title: cleft_anus
body:
deformation of the sphincter muscle of the [[anus]] and is a normal condition, but the anus is elongated vertically to an unusual degree. The key feature is the vertical opening rather than the overall shape, suggesting that the anus in images using this tag has been used roughly. In most cases, it is depicted with fine wrinkles, similar to [[puckered_anus]]. 

However, while it resembles puckered anus, the intended form is clearly different.
do not use this tag if the distinction is unclear.


h4. Examples

* !post #9638636
* !post #8479836
* !post #7886710
* !post #6305330

h4. Incorrect Examples

* !post #9225115: The hole is wide and there are many wrinkles, but the hole is not vertical. just use [[puckered anus]]
* !post #8069169: The hole is artificially widened and spread horizontally, which is not the typical shape of a hole.

title: miami_vice
body:
An American crime drama created by Anthony Yerkovich and produced by Michael Mann that aired on NBC from 1984 to 1989 for over five seasons. 

The series follows Don Johnson as James "Sonny" Crockett and Philip Michael Thomas as Ricardo "Rico" Tubbs, two undercover Miami police detectives as they solve and fight crime in [[Miami]]. Many of the cases the duo faced were based on real life crimes including drug smuggling, prostitution, gang wars between different crime groups like the [[Yakuza]] and [[Mafia]], crimes by refugees after escaping their country to the US and police corruption.

The series was a massive hit with many hit songs, cars and fashion on the show influencing the 1980s. Michael Mann would later direct a modern movie remake of Miami Vice in 2006.

title: ayane_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Secretary of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Okusora Ayane.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[crown braid]] decorated with a [[hair flower]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. She wears [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]] and has a [[red halo]]. Her default outfit is a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]] with an [[armband]] and an [[id card]], a [[yellow vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]] a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], an [[aqua necktie]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]].

Her personal weapon is a [[Sig P228/P229|SIG P229]] and she can deploy a [[drone]].

Voiced by: [[Harada Sayaka]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

title: seminar_(blue_archive)
body:
Seminar is the Student Council for the Millennium Science School in [[Blue Archive]].

The group originally began as a team of researchers attempting to solve the seven "Millennium Problems" that would eventually give their school its name. Eventually, as the scope of their project crept outward and into other areas of research, Millennium was founded and Seminar has taken a place as its executive committee.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

title: mayday_(air_crash_investigation)
body:
Canadian documentary series featuring airline accidents and incidents. It has a strong following on [[niconico]] and thus, many memes were made about the dub and the various featured crews, whether they show superior Airmanship (as in the Gimli Glider incident) or complete ineptitude (as in Air France Flight 447).
Pixiv users often add this tag humorously to images that cause the viewer to panic.

title: luigi
body:
[b]Luigi[/b] is [[Mario]]'s younger, but taller, twin brother. 

Luigi has assisted and fought alongside his brother on many occasions. Throughout his life, he has lived in Mario's shadow, developing both cowardly and heroic tendencies. [[Mario Bros.]] marks his first appearance in a Super Mario arcade game. Originally a color swap of Mario, Luigi was created to facilitate a second player option. Since the two-player mode was dropped from most [[Mario (series)|Super Mario]] games beginning with Super Mario Land, Luigi had gained his own identity and personality.

title: dark_magician_girl_the_magician's_apprentice
body:
[b]Attribute[/b]: DARK
[b]Level[/b]: 6
[b]Type[/b]: Spellcaster/Effect
[b]Effect[/b]: You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by discarding 1 card, and if you do, its name becomes "[[Dark Magician Girl]]". You can only Special Summon "Dark Magician Girl the Magician's Apprentice" once per turn this way. If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can add 1 "[[gold_sarcophagus|Shining Sarcophagus]]" from your Deck to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Dark Magician Girl the Magician's Apprentice" once per turn. Gains 300 ATK for each monster in the GYs that mentions "Shining Sarcophagus".
[b]ATK[/b]: 2000 [b]DEF[/b]: 1700

A variant of [[Dark Magician Girl]] [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]], being a retrained support for the "[[Gold_Sarcophagus]]" archetype.

She is largely similar to the original except that her clothing now has [[gold trim]], along with her breasts being [[huge breasts|significantly larger than the original]].

The sclera, also known as the "white of the eye," is the fibrous, protective, outer layer of the eye.

This tag refers to characters that have black sclera instead of the usual white. Commonly seen in [[demon girl|demon girls]], with [[astaroth (shinrabanshou)|Astaroth]] being a prime example.

title: kingprotea_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Extra CCC Fox Tail]], and can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is a version of [[Matou Sakura]] created after the legend of Earth Mother Goddesses in various myths. Appears as a [[giantess]] wrapped with [[bandages]] and a [[moss]]-covered body. In [[Fate/Extra CCC Fox Tail]] her [[bandage over one eye|eye bandage]] appears over her left eye, while in [[Fate/Grand Order]] it appears over her right eye. This is likely so that the battle sprite has her uncovered eye facing towards the player.

Her floral namesake is the [[protea (flower)|king protea]]. Her component spirits are all Earth Mother goddesses, including Titania (Titan), "Airavata":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airavata, and [[Tiamat (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Han Megumi]]

title: hisakawa_hayate
body:
[b]Hisakawa Hayate[/b] is an idol appearing in [i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i]. The last of seven new characters announced for 2019, she debuted in [[idolmaster cinderella girls starlight stage|Starlight Stage]] before Mobamas, fully voiced, alongside her [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] [[Hisakawa Nagi]]. She was added to Mobamas on April 5, 2019.

Like her sister, she has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[braided bangs]] along the side. Unlike her sister, she wears it untied with uneven [[bangs]], and has [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She's further distinguished by her expressive face and lively personality. She is voiced by [[Nagae Rika]].

title: zoh_shia
body:
Final boss of the low rank of [[Monster Hunter Wilds]]. An [[angel]]ic [[dragon]] that gradually casts off its white shell to invoke a [[fallen angel]], sorta like an inverse of [[Gore Magala]] becoming [[Shagaru Magala]].

[spoiler]It is the ultimate Guardian made by Wyveria, and as its shell is destroyed, it becomes more and more like an artificial [[Fatalis]], complete with its music mirroring that of the black dragon. Overall, it thought to be the realization of the once-unused [[Equal Dragon Weapon]] concept.

title: starlit_celebration_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It was given to players for free to celebrate [[nikki (nikki)|Nikki's]] birthday on December 6th, 2024.

The outfit includes a primarily pink, purple, and white [[multicolored dress|multicolored]], [[layered dress]] and pink [[high heels]]. The dress is decorated with ribbons and stars and is made of a [[glitter dress|glittery material]]. The hairstyle included with the outfit is a pair of [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[purple hair|purple]] [[twin drills]]. Accessories included with the outfit include a [[tiara]], pink [[leg ribbon|ribbon leg wraps]], and a star shaped [[star wand|wand]].

It has an alternate colored evolution that has a primarily yellow and blue color scheme instead.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25995006
* !asset #25995024: Starlit Celebration: Happiness
* !asset #28142060: Starlit Celebration: Sublime Intent

title: haibara_shiho
body: In her early forties, but looks more than ten years younger. A refined Yamato Nadeshiko with large F-cup breasts. Her husband committed suicide after an affair with her older sister (Hikimori's mother). She is raising her three daughters (Reina, Aya, and Narumi) using the assets of her own family, the Haibara family. As her nephew, she has a relatively favorable view of Hikimori. She believes that he is also a good person at heart. She is a faithful wife, and her only sexual experience was with her late husband. Her ex-husband taught her the techniques of service.

title: ominato_natsuko
body: A female college student who works at a convenience store near the protagonist, Wakasa Souji. She is a hard worker who greets everyone with a smile and is loved by those around her. She has a simple and innocent personality and little experience in love. She is kidnapped by the protagonist and forced to live as a pet in his room.

title: aroma_lady_(pokemon)
body:
A female-only Trainer class in the [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] series. Themed around flowers and scents, they specialize in Grass-types.

Wears a [[pink shirt]] and [[white skirt]] in [[pokemon rse|RSE]], [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]], and [[pokemon oras|ORAS]], and a [[white shirt]] and [[green skirt]] in [[pokemon dppt|DPPt]] and [[pokemon bdsp|BDSP]].

h4. See also

title: kuzumochi_(food)
body:
A type of Japanese [[dessert]] consisting of mochi cakes made from kudzu starch, usually topped with [[kinako_(food)|kinako]] and kuromitsu [[syrup]].

There exists a variety in the Kanto region made with fermented wheat starch that is also called kuzumochi.

title: biddybud
body:
An enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario 3D Land]]. They walk around a set path, usually in circles or lines and are typically found in groups. Biddybuds are pacifist and won't attack the player, though touching one still does damage.

Biddybuds are depicted as [[bug]]-like creatures, specifically [[ladybug]]s, that appear in red, yellow, green, blue or pink varieties. Like ladybugs, they have spots on their back and have two yellow feet and big eyes.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29790153: Red Biddybud
* !asset #29790191: Multiple Biddybuds

h4. Variants

* !asset #29790199: Pink [[Para-Biddybud]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Biddybud":https://www.mariowiki.com/Biddybud

title: para-biddybud
body:
A [[wings|winged]] variant of the [[Biddybud]] from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario 3D Land]]. They fly around a set path, usually in circles or lines and are typically found in groups. Para-Biddybuds are pacifist and won't attack the player, though touching one still does damage.

Para-Biddybuds are depicted as [[bug]]-like creatures, specifically [[ladybug]]s, that appear in red, yellow, green, blue or pink varieties and have a pair of [[white wings]]. Like ladybugs, they have spots on their back and have two yellow feet and big eyes.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29790199: Pink Para-Biddybud
* !asset #29790252: Multiple Para-Biddybuds

h4. See also

* [[Biddybud]]
* [[Biddybuggy]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Para-Biddybud":https://www.mariowiki.com/Para-Biddybud

title: tri-brigade_ferrijit_the_barren_blossom
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] and one of the characters from the Branded storyline. A [[pink hair|pink-haired]] slit-eyed [[cat girl]] belonging to the Claw Tribe, she's one of the three leaders of the Tri-Brigade mercenary group, alongside [[tri-brigade rugal the silver sheller|Rugal]] and [[tri-brigade_shuraig_the_ominous_omen|Shuraig]]. She wears a brown top, a black jacket, goggles used for sniping from long distances, brown shorts, and brown boots. Her younger sister is [[Kitt (yu-gi-oh!)|Kitt]], who upgrades her sniper rifle to [[Tri-Brigade Arms Mouser]].

Voice Actress: [[Inoue Marina|Marina Inoue]]
other_names: 鉄獣戦線徒花のフェリジット

title: naberius_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. She is the Ruler of Life among the Four Shades of the Heavenly Principles.

Naberius was created by the Heavenly Principles during the war against the Seven Sovereigns and was responsible for helping create animals, plants and humans. She also created [[Egeria (genshin impact)|]] as the new heart of the Primordial Sea after the Hydro Dragon was removed from it's postition.

Sometime after the Cataclysm, her heart was discovered and consumed by [[Rhinedottir (genshin impact)|]] and Naberius fused with her.

Voiced by Ivy Dupler in English, [[Yamaguchi Yuriko]] in Japanese and Di Feifei in Chinese.

title: eula_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

She is the captain of the Knights of Favonius' Reconnaissance Company and a descendant of the Lawrence Clan, a prominent family in Mondstadt infamous for its tyrannical reign before it was overthrown in an uprising led by the Dandelion Knight. 

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]]-length [[blue hair]]. In her default outfit she wears [[thigh boots]] with blue, black and white clothes. She wields the [[sword]] [[Song of Broken Pines (Genshin Impact)|]].

title: cats_are_liquid
body:
The humorous idea that [[cat]]s are basically a liquid due to their flexibility. This typically involves cats literally made of liquid, cats fitting to containers that usually contain liquids such as [[cup]]s or [[bottle]]s, or cats being poured like a liquid.

Sometimes also applied to other creatures, usually directly juxtaposed with the phrase "X is/are liquid".

h4. See also

* [[cats are scared of cucumbers]]

title: rosa_(pokemon)
body:
The female protagonist of [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 and White 2]]. Sometimes nicknamed "Donut-ko". Her male counterpart is [[Nate (pokemon)|]].

Known as [b]Mei[/b] in Japanese versions. Their Japanese names come from [i]kyoumei[/i] (共鳴), meaning "resonance". In English, this association is also kept, with "resonate" turning into "Rosa" and "Nate". 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]] with [[double bun|double]] [[donut hair bun]]s. She wears a [[visor cap]], a shirt with [[raglan sleeves]] and a [[pink bow]], [[yellow shorts|yellow]] [[short shorts]] [[pantyhose under shorts|worn over]] [[black pantyhose]], [[sneakers]], and she carries a [[handbag]].

Already a popular player character in her own right, Rosa enjoyed a resurgence in popularity after being revealed as an early-game free character in the story of [[Pokemon Masters EX]]. In this game, Rosa's partner is [[Snivy]], and became known for her upbeat attitude and [[stroking own chin|multitude]] of [[+_+|expressions]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Whitley[/b] (ファイツ [i]Whi-Two[/i] in Japanese).

h4. Official Art
* !post #2480022: Default
* !post #8963485: Concept Art leaked during the [[2024 Pokemon Teraleak]], revealing a tank top she wears under her shirt (left)

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Whitley (Adventures)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Whitley_(Adventures)]

title: hornet_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Essex[/i]-class carrier USS [i]Hornet[/i] in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Not to be confused with [[Hornet (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CV-8]], although it is specified that Hornet II has the body and memories of the original Hornet but with Essex-class equipment and abilities. Character design by [[Kurumi (recycllamo)|]], voiced by Yamamoto Nozomi. In her [i]Essex[/i]-class form, she retains virtually all of her [i]Yorktown[/i]-class dress attributes but with some updates. She is still portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]] and [[green eyes]]. Her attire still consists of a [[black bikini|black]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]], a pair of [[short shorts]], and [[black thighhighs]], though she now gains [[thigh strap]]s above the thighhighs. She sports a pair of black [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]] that stop right before the knuckle and have a yellow stripe along their length, as well as a dashing [[cowboy hat]], with a [[yellow belt]] and underside. Her [[black coat]] loses the number 8, however. Her [[rigging]] is now the same as the [i]Essex[/i]-class: a split [[flight deck]], one half on each side. h4. Appearance * !post #5920479: Default * !post #5923684: [[hornet ii (racing across the waves) (azur lane)|Racing Across the Waves]] (can be used with the original Hornet) h4. Related Characters h5. title: uss_yorktown_(cv-10)
body:
An [i]Essex[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]] of the [[United States Navy]], CV-10 was originally ordered with the assigned name [i]Bonhomme Richard[/i], but was renamed [i]Yorktown[/i] while under construction after [[uss yorktown (cv-5)|CV-5]] was sunk at the [[Battle of Midway]] in 1942. [I]Yorktown[/i] was commissioned in 1943 and earned sixteen battle stars from combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]] and the [[Vietnam War]]. It was also a recovery vessel for the Apollo 8 space mission, as well as playing a starring role in several feature films, including [i]Tora Tora Tora[/i]. [I]Yorktown[/i] was decommissioned for the last time in 1970, and is currently a museum ship at Patriot's Point, South Carolina. 

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions 

* [[Yorktown II (Azur Lane)]] 
* [[USS Yorktown (CV-10) (Y.Ssanoha)]] 

h4. See also

* [[USS Yorktown (CV-5)]] Her predecessor and namesake

title: uss_hornet_(cv-12)
body:
An [i]Essex[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]] of the [[United States Navy]], CV-12 was originally ordered with the assigned name [i]Kearsarge[/i], but was renamed [i]Hornet[/i] while under construction after [[uss hornet (cv-8)|CV-8]] was sunk at the [[Battle of Santa Cruz]] in 1942. [I]Hornet[/i] was commissioned in 1943 and earned thirteen battle stars from combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]] and the [[Vietnam War]]. It was also a recovery vessel for several space missions from the Apollo program, most famously [[Apollo 11]]. [I]Hornet[/i] was decommissioned for the last time in 1970, and is currently a museum ship in Alameda, California, near the city of [[San Francisco]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises. 

h4. Depictions 

* [[Hornet II (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Hornet-Chan (Carriercon)]]
* [[USS Hornet (CV-12) (Y.Ssanoha)]] 

h4. See also

* [[USS Hornet (CV-8)]] Her predecessor and namesake

title: miyu_(swimsuit)_(blue_archive)
body:
A summer [[Official alternate costume|costume]] for [[Miyu (blue archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]].

The outfit consists of a [[leaf print]] [[print bikini|bikini]] with a frilled [[ribbon choker]] and black [[crocs]]. Her hair is worn in [[twin braids]] and she carries a [[weapon case]].

Frequently depicted being harassed by various seaside wildlife such as [[seagull]]s and [[starfish]].

Costume artist: [[YutokaMizu]]

title: hoshino_(first_year)_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable alternate design of [[Hoshino (Blue Archive)|]]'s shown in flashbacks in the [[Blue Archive]] story.

Unlike her standard design, she has [[short hair]], and most often has an angry or serious expression. She normally wears a [[bulletproof vest]] and an [[armband]] over her Abydos school uniform, but may instead be wearing the [[abydos high school swimsuit]]. She may be depicted together with [[Yume (Blue Archive)|]].

Hoshino's first year design differs from her [[Hoshino (Armed) (Blue Archive)|Armed]] playable skin in that she did not have a ponytail, nor did her standard outfit feature a holster for her pistol worn atop the chest.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22484690: Default
* !asset #22484689: [[Abydos High School Swimsuit]]

h4. See also

* [[Hoshino (Second Year) (Blue Archive)]]

title: hoshino_(second_year)_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable alternate design of [[Hoshino (Blue Archive)|]]'s shown in flashbacks in the [[Blue Archive]] story.

Unlike her standard design, she wears her hair in a [[ponytail]] that [[long hair|reaches to her shoulders]]. She normally wears a [[grey sweater]] and [[pantyhose]], and will sometimes also be wearing a blue [[jacket]] or a blue [[striped scarf]] around her neck (she later gives this scarf to [[Shiroko (Blue Archive)|]].)

h4. Appearance

title: wet_skirt
body: A [[skirt]] visibly [[wet]] with water or a similar liquid. Whilst not as frequent as a [[wet shirt]], a wet skirt may be [[see-through skirt|see-through]]. Characters may also [[wringing skirt|wring their skirt]] as to force liquid out from it.

title: baking
body:
Any image centered around baking sweets, desserts and bread. An establishment entirely devoted to baking is a [[bakery]].

Similar to baking is [[cooking]], but it's said that, "Cooking is an art, while baking is a science." This is true, as baking recipes are far more stringent and don't allow for much manipulation, lest the product fails.

h4.See also

* [[baking sheet]] 
* [[chocolate making]] 
* [[cookie cutter]]  
* [[cooking together]] 
* [[decorating baked goods]] 
* [[kneading dough]] 
* [[whisking]]

title: justin_wong_(gamer)
body:
An American fighting game pro gamer originally from New York. Known for his dominance in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series (especially [i]Marvel vs. Capcom 2[/i]), as well as being the player on the receiving end of [[Umehara Daigo]]'s [[Evo moment #37|full parry]] at [[Evolution Championship Series|Evolution]] 2004. Eight-time [[Evolution Championship Series|EVO]] champion (six times in [i][[Marvel vs. Capcom 2]][/i], once in [i][[street fighter iii (series)|Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike]][/i] teams, and once in [i][[Marvel vs. Capcom 3|Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3]][/i]), the most in the event's history.

h4. See also

* [[Evo Moment #37]]
* [[Heart hands failure]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Justin Wong":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Wong
* "YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC98DqRRDSGQ0y68XEihDQzw
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/JWonggg]

title: ikari_(game)
body:
A 1986 run-and-gun video game published by [[SNK]]. The game stars [[Ralf Jones]] and [[Clark Still]] as Player 1 and Player 2 respectively, and they are also members of the Ikari team in [[The King Of Fighters]] series. Otherwise known as [b]Ikari Warriors[/b] with main characters [b]Paul[/b] and [b]Vincent[/b] elsewhere.

title: despicable_me
body:
Despicable Me is a 2010 American computer-animated 3D comedy film from Universal Pictures and Illumination Entertainment that was released on July 9, 2010 in the [[United States]]. It is Illumination Entertainment's first film. It was directed by Pierre Coffin and Chris Renaud, based on an original story by Sergio Pablos. Famous for the yellow [[minion (despicable me)|]]s.

h4. See also
* [Wikipedia article](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Despicable_Me)
* [TV Tropes page](http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/WesternAnimation/DespicableMe)

title: goombrat
body:
A [[Goomba]]-like enemy from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[New Super Mario Bros. U]]. Like Goombas, they will chase the player  upon sighting them and can be defeated in the same manner, usually by stomping on them. However, Goombrats turn when they reach a ledge instead of falling off.

Goombrats are depicted with a very similar appearance to a Goomba, though they resemble a [[persimmon]] rather than a [[mushroom]]. They also have a [[scowl]] instead of eyebrows and two large [[fangs]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #29890682

h4. See also

* [[Goomba]]
* [[Goombud]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Goombrat":https://www.mariowiki.com/Goombrat

title: tsurumaru_kuninaga
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character.

A [[tachi (weapon)|tachi]] forged by Gojou Kuninaga. He had gone through several owners (one of them being Oda Nobunaga, so he is often depicted in fanworks alongside other swords owned by him), and was stolen from his owners twice; once from the grave of Sadayasu of the Adachi clan, and also from a shrine by Koudeki of the Honami Clan. He is currently part of the Imperial Collection alongside [[Ichigo Hitofuri]], [[Uguisumaru]] and [[Hirano Toushirou]].

Because of how he tended to be stolen from his resting place, and because of his long life in general, Tsurumaru has a love of surprises and likes to sneak up on people to surprise them. This has naturally earned him a reputation of being a troll in fanworks who plays pranks on the other characters for his own amusement. 

He has [[white hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], and wears [[Japanese clothes]] with a [[hood]] and [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom pom]]s. He has [[black gloves]] that are [[partially fingerless gloves|partly fingerless]] and [[Japanese armor]] at his waist.

His name is written with the kanji for "[[crane_(animal)|crane]]", and he often references how he resembles one due to his white clothing. Ironically, despite cranes representing longevity and good fortune in Japanese culture, most of his masters did not live long.

h4. See also

* pool #10031 - God Damn It, Tsurumaru!

title: ookanehira_(touken_ranbu)
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. 

One of the Kobizen school swords crafted by Kanehira, who was gifted to the Ikeda clan. While both Ookanehira and Doujigiri are known as the "East and West Yokuzuna of Japanese Swords", only Doujigiri was accepted as one of the Tenka Goken. [i]Touken Ranbu[/i]'s Ookanehira views Doujigiri as a rival because of this, and additionally harbors more than a little resentment towards the other Heavenly Swords. Fans tend to take this resentment and turn it into a full-blown obsession over being better than them. Amusingly enough, the only one of the Heavenly Swords he's not rude to is [[Juzumaru Tsunetsugu]], who remains polite with him, causing him to be polite in turn.

Before being added to the game, he was mentioned by [[Uguisumaru]].

Voiced by [[Ono Yuuki]]. Character designer is [[komo (sleepy)]].

h4.See Also
* [[Ookanehira Nagame]] - Equivalent [i][[Shinken!!]][/i] character
* [[Ookanehira (Tenka Hyakken)]] - Equivalent [i][[Tenka Hyakken]][/i] character

body:

In her default costume, she wears a [[chest sarashi]], a [[blue shawl]], a [[shimenawa]] [[hairband]] that is colored [[white hairband|white]], [[multiple earrings|multiple]] [[tooth earrings]] and [[black pants]]. She has [[red eyes|red]] [[cephalopod eyes]] and is often depicted with her [[blue hair|blue]] [[hair over one eye]]. Her default footwear includes [[black socks]] / [[tabi]] on top of [[platform footwear|platform]] [[okobo]].

title: paul_(splatoon)
body:
NPC in [i][[Splatoon 2]][/i].

A young [[octoling player character|Octoling]] DJ for the band SashiMori. As he is not fully matured yet, he retains the fully colored skin of child octolings (in this case, [[red skin]]). His normal clothes consists of a black [[t-shirt]] and [[white shorts]]. He also wears a red [[beanie]] with the logo of [[Dedf1sh]] on it, indicating he's a fan.

In [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i], which takes place 7 years after the events of Splatoon 2, he appears much older.

title: octoling
body:
A species of humanoid cephalopods in the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series that can transform into [[octoling_(swim_form)|octopi]] and back to their humanoid form at will.

They are a type of "Octarian":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Octarian], and are initially introduced as the main antagonist species of [[Splatoon 1]]. [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]] had the first appearance of them as a protagonist in the form of [[Agent 8 (Splatoon)|]]. In [[Splatoon 2]], they are unlockable playable main characters for the multiplayer modes and [[Salmon Run (Splatoon)|]] upon beating Octo Expansion. [[Splatoon 3]] lets you be one from the start. Thus Splatoon 3's base game story mode protagonist, [[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)]], can be either an Inkling or an Octoling. 

The player can choose from an [[Octoling Boy]] or an [[Octoling Girl]].

Use this species tag for any of the following characters, as long as they aren't depicted as an [[alternate species]] (e.g. a full-on human / [[humanization]]):

h4. Characters

* [b][[Octoling player character]][/b]
** [[Octoling Girl]]
** [[Octoling Boy]]
* [b]Idols[/b]
** [[Marina (Splatoon)|]]
** [[Shiver (Splatoon)|]]
* [b][[Squidbeak Splatoon]] (story mode cast)[/b]
** [[Agent 8 (Splatoon)|]], player character for both [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]] and [[Splatoon 3: Side Order]].
** [[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)|New Agent 3]], player character for Splatoon 3's hero mode. Can also be an [[Inkling]].
* [b]Promotional Material Octolings[/b]
** [[Hirooooo (Splatoon)|]] 
** [[Kayoss (Splatoon)|]] 
** [[Yarrwhal (Splatoon)|]] 
* [b]Other Octolings[/b] (WIP)
** [[Dedf1sh]] (Acht)
** [[DJ Octavio]]
** [[Paul (splatoon)|]]
** [[Mashup (splatoon)|Mashup]]
** [[Hachi (splatoon)|]]
** [[Tao Blu (splatoon)|]]

h6. Identifying [[Octoling]]s (as opposed to [[Inkling]]s)

Octolings have a few key traits that Inklings don't:
* rounded ears as opposed to Inklings' [[pointy ears]]
* no black line that connects their eyes like Inklings
* their suction cups appear on the [i]outside[/i] of their [[tentacle hair]] (e.g. post #7028055)
* sometimes depicted with [[cephalopod eyes]] (e.g. post #7464499 - the figure-8 shaped horizontal pupils)
** (the named Octolings, particularly the Idols, are nearly always depicted with them)
* unique hairstyles, see "this list of them (Splatoon wiki)":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Player_Settings#Octoling]
** [[mohawk]], [[afro]] and [[short ponytail]] are some examples that are used for Octolings as opposed to Inklings.

Post #7190600 is a good comparison of these traits, with an Inkling on the left and an Octoling on the right.

Typical tags common to both Inklings and Octolings include [[tentacle hair]] and [[thick eyebrows]].

title: frye_(splatoon)
body:
[i][[Splatoon 3]][/i] character. Full name is [b]Frye Onaga[/b]. Named [b]Utsuho[/b] in the Japanese version. Member of the band Deep Cut and an [[inkling]].

She has [[star-shaped pupils]] just like the other Inkling Idols [[Callie (Splatoon)|]], [[Marie (Splatoon)|]] and [[Pearl (splatoon)|]]. She also has [[long pointy ears]], notably longer than most Inklings. Other unique elements of her default costume & appearance include: [[white pants|white]] [[harem pants]], [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[sleeveless shirt]] as a [[crop top]], a [[yellow shawl]], [[multiple earrings|multiple]] [[tooth earrings]], and [[colored eyelashes]]. Her hairstyle includes an [[x hair ornament]] and a [[hair tie]].

In her boss battle in the story mode, she controls [[moray eel]]s.

title: harmony_(splatoon)
body:
Minor [i][[Splatoon_(series)|]][/i] character. 

She is a singer in the band Chirpy Chips (ABXY in Japanese), alongside [[Sid (splatoon)|]], [[Orion (splatoon)|]] and [[Clash (splatoon)|]].

Like [[Annie (splatoon)|]], Harmony is a sea anemone girl who has a black [[harmony's_clownfish_(splatoon)|clownfish]] living in her hair. She has long pink [[tentacle hair]], green eyes, and prominent eyelashes. She wears a [[baseball cap]], a long shirt, and a pleated green miniskirt. Due to her lackadasial nature,  Harmony is often seen [[drooling]] ([[mouth drool]]).

As with many of the bands that are not Sea O' Colors (the Squid Sisters), she doesn't physically appear in [[Splatoon 1]] or [[Splatoon 2]]. However, her design has garnered fans' attention more than any of the other non-appearing band members in the games. She would later make her game debut in [[Splatoon 3]] as shopkeep for the general store Hotlantis.

The name previously used on this wiki, "Glenna Nalira", is not her official name. The English Splatoon wiki temporarily christened her with it.

title: clash_(splatoon)
body: Character from [[Splatoon (series)|]]. He's an [[inkling]], and the guitarist and backup singer of Chirpy Chirps (ABXY in Japanese), alongside [[Harmony (splatoon)|]], [[Sid (splatoon)|]] and [[Orion (splatoon)|]]. Called Noisy ('Noiji') in Japanese.

title: stasis
body:
An Armored Core NEXT [[mecha]] in [[Armored Core: For Answer]], piloted by Otsdarva.

title: mind_beta_(armored_core_vi)
body:
A humanoid [[mecha]] from [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

It is an Armored Core with full frame of MIND ALPHA series (not to be confused with MIND BETA variant parts, which [[Mind Gamma (Armored Core Vi)|]] uses), produced by [[ALLMIND (Armored Core Vi)|]].

[[Kate Markson]]'s AC 'Transcriber' uses the exact same parts, weaponry and coloration, making them impossible to distinguish from each other.

title: beni-enma
body:
Saber-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the sparrow from the Japanese fable [i]Shita-kiri Suzume[/i] ("Tongue-Cut Sparrow"). Her Noble Phantasm is "Jyuu-Ou Hanketsu - Tsuzura no Michiyuki".

When not in battle, she is the proprietress of the Enma Pavilion, and runs a culinary course for Heroic Spirits -- her strict nature and acerbic tongue towards her students has given her the fan nickname "loli birb [[Gordon Ramsay]]".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Harada Takehito]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kuno Misaki]]

title: gallant_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] destroyer HMS [i]Gallant[/i] (H59).  

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[aqua eyes]]. Her default outfit is a policewoman theme and consists of a [[black hat|black]] British [[police hat]], [[red cape]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with a [[black necktie]] and [[whistle]], [[white shorts]] with a [[black belt]] and [[holster]] for her [[handgun]], [[white pantyhose]], [[black boots]], and [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is a sentient hull resembling an attack dog, containing a 120 mm single gun mount and canisters. 

h4. Skins

* !post #9350335: Default
* !post #9364636: [[Gallant (express-ive delivery) (azur lane)|Express-ive Delivery]]

title: chris_hansen
body:
Christopher Edward Hansen (born September 13, 1959) is an American television presenter, journalist, and YouTube personality. During his tenure as a correspondent for Dateline NBC, he hosted the program's segment [[To Catch a Predator]] (2004–2007), which revolved around catching potential Internet predators using a sting operation. When the segment's three-year run concluded, Hansen continued to host similarly formatted shows on other networks.

After parting ways with NBC in 2013, he began hosting Killer Instinct on Investigation Discovery in 2015, a short-lived series that documented homicide investigations. That same year, he replaced Matt Doran as the host of the syndicated series Crime Watch Daily, which he hosted for two seasons and had his own segment similar to his Dateline feature, Hansen vs. Predator. He co-founded the true crime-oriented streaming service TruBlu in 2020, where he produced and starred in the web series Takedown with Chris Hansen.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chris Hansen":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Hansen

title: faroja
body:
A Lovemaiden, a psychic priestess that worships planet Venus's giant bleeding heart in the sky. She lives in a temple on Venus with three other Lovemaidens named [[Iroja]], [[Conja]], her sister [[Teja]], and a Templemaiden named [[Mioja]].

[spoiler]At the end of [[HEARTLOVEPOWERTEMPLE]], Faroja is absorbed into Conja's body with the intention of rebirthing her as the Rabbitmaiden of Earth later.[/spoiler]

title: mint_fantome_(minto_2.0)
body:
The current default costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Mint Fantome]], replacing her [[Mint Fantome (minto 1.0)|old design]] from March 2021 onwards. It was originally illustrated by [[kgr]], with the design finalized by [[Ichika Maia (artist)|]]. On Halloween 2024, she debuted an update, illustrated by [[Ayamy]], which she refers to as her 3.0 model.

It's a [[maid]] outfit consisting of a [[triangular headpiece]], a [[maid headdress]], a [[green dress|green]]/[[aqua dress|aqua]] [[vertical-striped dress|vertical-stripped]] [[backless dress|backless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[center frills]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] [[skirt under dress|under it]], [[aqua sleeves|aqua]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[black bow]], [[uneven legwear]] (a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white]] [[frilled thighhighs|frilled thighhigh]] with a [[black garter straps|black garter strap]] and a [[white socks|white]] [[bobby socks|bobby sock]]) and [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]].

Some of the differences between the 2.0 and the 3.0 version are that she wears a [[leotard under clothes|leotard]] under her dress in the 2.0 version, while she wears normal underwear on the 3.0 version, the length of her sleeves is also different, which go [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] on her 2.0 model but only [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]] on the 3.0 version, also the bridal [[frilled thigh strap]] from her 2.0 version is replaced with a blue [[thigh strap]] with a [[heart-shaped buckle]], and she also has [[pointy ears]] on 3.0.

She has an [[alternate color]] version called Lilac where magenta-purple replaces the white-green.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8370264: Profile (3.0)
* !post #8370267: Reference sheet (3.0)
* !post #7490093: Reference sheet (2.0)

title: rhythm_tengoku
body:
A series of rhythm games starting with the eponymous [i][[Rhythm Tengoku (game)|]][/i] (lit. "Rhythm Heaven") for [[Game Boy Advance]]. The original game was never sold outside of its home country, allowing its sequels to be confusingly named.

Its sequels are:

* [[Rhythm Tengoku Gold]], aka "Rhythm Heaven" (US) or "Rhythm Paradise" (Europe), for the [[Nintendo DS|DS]].
* [[Minna no Rhythm Tengoku]], aka "Rhythm Heaven Fever" (US) or "Beat the Beat: Rhythm Paradise" (Europe), for the [[Wii]].
* [[Rhythm Tengoku The Best+]], aka "Rhythm Heaven Megamix" (US) or "Rhythm Paradise Megamix" (Europe), for the [[Nintendo 3DS|3DS]].
* [[Rhythm Tengoku Miracle Stars]], aka "Rhythm Heaven Groove" (US) or "Rhythm Paradise Groove" (Europe), for the [[Nintendo Switch|Switch]].

h4.  External links

* "Wikipedia: Rhythm Heaven (series)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_Heaven_(series)

title: to_catch_a_predator
body:
To Catch a Predator was a 2004 American reality show that aired on NBC. Hosted by [[Chris Hansen]], the show has suspected sexual predators arrived at a location as part of sting operation to meet with minors, unaware the minors they have been communicating were actually adults, where Chris reveals himself and interviews the suspects before being arrested by local police.

The show has a mixed reception since some argue the ethical and legal concerns raised over the nature of the sting operations it depicted, in particular potential violations of entrapment laws. The show was cancelled in 2007 due to suicide of a suspected pedophile named Bill Conradt that was filmed by the show, who were later sued by the suspect's family.

title: gundam_card_game
body:
The [b]Gundam Card Game[/b] ([i]Gandamukādogēmu[/i]) is a planned collectible card game based on the [[Gundam]] anime franchise published by [[Bandai]] Card Games. 

It was first announced on October 3, 2024 with simultaneous releases in three languages: [[Japan]]ese, [[english_text|English]] and [[chinese_text|Simple Chinese]].

Limited in-store play-testing began in Japan on November 15, 2024, while play-testing began in North America, Europe, Latin America, and Oceania on January 31, 2025.

h4. External links

* "Official Website":https://www.gundam-gcg.com/

title: dougi
body:
A uniform for training, used in Japanese [[martial arts]] such as [[karate]]. This term is otherwise known as keikogi ([i]keiko[/i] means practice, [i]gi[/i] means dress or clothes).

The top part of the uniform is a [[jacket]] called [[uwagi]], and is tied by a [[martial arts belt]]. The bottom part is a pair of [[pants]] called shitabaki.

In [[Korea]], [i]dougi[/i] are called [i][[dobok]][/i] (도복), and are used for Korean [[martial arts]] such as [[taekwondo]].

h4. See also

* [[martial arts]]
* [[karate]]
* [[dobok]] 
** [[taekwondo]]
* [[judo]]

* "Wikipedia: Keikogi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keikogi]
