title: kenneth_sleg
body: A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

title: hathaway_noa
body:
The son of [[Bright Noa]]. First seen as a child in [[Zeta Gundam]], he rises to prominence as a teenager in [[Char's Counterattack]] before taking center stage in [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|Hathaway's Flash]].

[spoiler]During the final space battle of The Second Neo Zeon War, [[Quess Paraya]] (a girl who a teen Hathaway Noa was in love with) gets accidentally killed by [[Chan Agi]] (who pilots a damaged [[Re-GZ]]) while trying to protect Hathaway. Then Chan is herself killed by an enraged Hathaway in a [[Jegan]]. 

All these tragic events would haunt Hathaway for the rest of his life and serve as catalysts for his transformation into [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] years later. Under this alias he commands the eponymous terrorist organization and pilots the [[Xi Gundam]] against the now corrupt [[Earth Federation]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Quess Paraya]]
* [[Cheimin Noa]]

title: varauta
body:
An antagonist [[alien]] [[space]] [[army]] from the [[Macross 7]] TV series.

It is a new [[Supervision Army]] created by the [[Protodeviln]] when they re-awakened and escaped from their prision in the Varauta [[star (symbol)|]] system. 

The [b]Varauta Army[/b] is formed with brainwashed Humans and [[Zentradi]] from the lost [i]Megaroad-13[/i] colonization fleet. Most of their [[spaceships]] and [[mecha]] are alien-looking, modified versions of those of the [[U.N. Spacy]]. As such, they are an unique antagonist force that employs [[variable fighter]]s against the Human/[[Zentradi]] Alliance.

title: noodles
body:
A staple food made from dough (whether made with bread wheat, durum wheat, buckwheat, rice, etc. and may or may not include eggs), which is prepared in various ways depending on the type of noodle (one example being rolled flat and made into long thin strips), then boiled in water until done (whether al dente or not). Popular types of noodles include Central European noodles such as spaetzle, Italian [[pasta]] such as [[spaghetti]], and East Asian noodles such as [[ramen]] (which are the focus of this tag).

Do not use this tag or its implied tags if the only thing depicted is a container for instant noodles, unless the noodles themselves can be seen within or on the packaging. Use [[cup ramen]] or [[pack noodles]] instead.

h4. Noodle types

* [[ramen]]
* [[udon]]
* [[soba]]
* [[soumen]]
* [[cellophane noodles]]

h4. See also

* [[chopsticks]] 
* [[noodle strainer]]
* [[tteokbokki]] - sometimes referred to as tteokmyeon (떡면; "rice cake noodles")

title: dura_erede_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Dura" as in his sire's name + Italian: "Heir". This implies that he is his sire's successor.[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Marchesa (racehorse)|]] (A half-sister of [[Satono Diamond (racehorse)|]] and sired by [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]]).

This goofball of a thoroughbred is famous for winning the 2022 Hopeful Stakes but also infamous for throwing off his jockey at a already very messy 2023 Japanese Derby, as well as managing to find himself running in the Sapporo Kinen (turf race) 2 weeks after the Elm Stakes (dirt race) in 2024. However, he seems to be the type that is strong on both Turf and Dirt.

title: onyankopon_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Given etymology is Akan (Twi): "Supreme being, God". The name of an aspect of the Akan religion's supreme deity, "Nyame":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyankapon-Nyame-Odomankoma].[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Eishin Flash (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Chariot d'Or (racehorse)|]], he is infamous for his name that, despite the given etymology, it has a cutesy, cat-like ring to it. Then again, it was given to him with the acknowledgement of that disparity and the effect it would have.

He is a bay horse with a stripe facial marking and a stocking on his right hind leg.

Aside for the name, he is still one of Eishin Flash's most successful progeny (not that it means much, he has a single GIII victory), only [[Vela Azul (racehorse)|]] (2022 Japan Cup) beats him in that respect.

title: sweep_feet_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Suave Richard (Racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Bijou Tosho (racehorse)|]] (a daughter of [[Sweep Tosho (Racehorse)|]] with [[Deep Sky (Racehorse)|]]). A chestnut mare with a wide blaze marking and very long stockings on her front left leg and back right leg, a sock on her back left leg and a pastern on her front right leg.
She is one of the most notable descendants of Sweep Tosho, being their only graded winner with her G2 win at the Tulip Sho.

title: hayayakko_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Fast White (block of tofu)"[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Marshmellow (racehorse)|]]. He is a white horse from the Shirayukihime lineage, just like [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]].

A long-time runner, he initially gained fame as the first white horse to have won graded races on both turf and dirt. His best race is the 2024 Copa Republica Argentina (G2), where he brilliantly snatched victory at age 8 (giving him the highest handicap) by catching up from the back with his chaser running style, winning by a neck against 1st favourite [[Chrominance (racehorse)|]].

title: halwa_sweet_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Machiavellian (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Halwa Song (racehorse)|]]. She was first famous for having no tail; being born without one, then for being the mother of three G1 winners: [[Verxina (racehorse)|]], [[Cheval Grand (racehorse)|]] and [[Vivlos (racehorse)|]].

Halwa" means "candy" in Arabic, thus "Sweet candy". Derived from her dam's name.

h4. See also

* [[Sasaki Kazuhiro]] - Fan; his determination to buy all her foals by any means necessary led her to own all three of the aforementioned G1 winners as well as their siblings

title: star_trek_into_darkness
body:
Star Trek Into Darkness is a 2013 American science fiction action film. It is the 12th installment in the [[Star Trek]] franchise and the sequel to the 2009 film Star Trek, as the second in a rebooted film series. It features Chris Pine reprising his role as Captain [[James Tiberius Kirk|James T. Kirk]], with Zachary Quinto, Simon Pegg, Karl Urban, Zoe Saldaña, John Cho, Anton Yelchin, Bruce Greenwood, and Leonard Nimoy reprising their roles from the previous film. 

It was [[leonard nimoy|Nimoy's]] last film appearance before his death in 2015. Set in the 23rd century, the film follows Kirk and the crew of [[USS Enterprise]] as they are sent to the [[Klingon]] homeworld seeking the terrorist John Harrison.
other_names: スター・トレックイントゥ・ダークネス

title: star_trek:_kelvin_timeline
body:
A term for the movie series reboot of [[Star Trek]] from 2009-2016.

The Kelvin timeline, or "alternate universe Trek", is an alternate timeline that diverged from [[Star Trek: The Original Series]] decades before the original series took place, allowing the reboot to tell new stories with the same characters without retconning the original series. The name of the timeline comes from the event that caused the divergence, the destruction of the [i]USS Kelvin[/i].

h4. Films in the series

* [[Star Trek (2009)]]
* [[Star Trek Into Darkness]]
* [[Star Trek: Beyond]]

title: t-head_trainer_(umamusume)
body:
The [[trainer (umamusume)|]]  from [[Umamusume]], depicted with a capital "T" for the head, similar to the [[T-head Admiral]] seen in [[Kantai Collection]] art (and [[Idolmaster]]'s [[P-head Producer]]).  The "T" is derived from the first letter of "Trainer". A similar example is a trainer whose face is a T (or a T-shaped mask) as opposed to the entire head.

There is another related character, the [i]To-head Trainer[/i]. This is like the T-head Trainer, but with a ト (Japanese katakana "to", from the first kana of [i]toreenaa[/i]/"trainer") instead of a T. As it still starts vocally with a T (and may resemble a "wide T" turned 90 degrees onto its side to English readers), it falls under this tag too.

title: supergirl
body:
[b]Supergirl[/b], also known by her Kryptonian name as [b]Kara Zor-El[/b] is a character from [[DC Comics]]' [[Superman (series)|]] series. She is the young female counterpart of [[Superman]], usually having the same powers as he does.

There are many iterations of the character "Supergirl", but the most well-known and generally considered the "base" version is Kara Zor-El. She came from Argo City, which survived the destruction of her home planet Krypton but soon came to its own destruction. As Superman (Kal-El) is the last son of Krypton, then Supergirl, his cousin, is the last daughter of Krypton, with both coming from the same family house of El. She wears a female version of Superman's costume that usually gives her a [[skirt]] among other feminine alterations depending on her variation.

For an older female counterpart to Superman and her variations or costumes based on them, use the [[Superwoman]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[Power Girl]]

title: noelle_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Like most of Mondstadt's young people, Noelle always dreamed of being a knight of Favonius when she grew up. She may not have what it takes to be a knight just yet, but she is learning. Working as a [[maid]] at the Knights' headquarters, she is constantly taking notes on what constitutes knightly speech, knightly conduct, and knightly customs. She holds firm to her belief that one day she will join their ranks — she just needs to keep trying her hardest at everything she does.

h4. Appearance

title: doner_kebab
body:
A popular Eastern Mediterranean [[cooking]] method, done by cutting [[meat]] into thin slices, stacked in a cone-like shape, and roasted on a slowly-turning [[vertical rotisserie]] or spit. Traditionally made with lamb or mutton, it may also be made with [[chicken (food)|]], [[beef]], [[turkey (food)|]] or veal ([[pork]] can even be an option if made by non-[[Muslim]]s). Thin slices are shaved off the cooked surface as it continuously rotates, which are then used in various [[food|dish]]es.

This method has many names, from the original Turkish name of 'döner kebab', the Middle Eastern 'shawarma', and the Greek 'gyros', with the first two used as synonyms of the other in other languages. It is common for dishes that use the meat made with this method, whichever way it is referred to, to be referred to with that name as well, most famously [[pita (food)|flatbread]] [[doner sandwich|sandwich]]es and [[doner wrap|wrap]]s.

h4. See also

* [[al pastor]]
* [[doner sandwich]]
* [[doner wrap]]
* [[shish kebab]]
* [[sliced meat]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Doner kebab":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doner_kebab and "Shawarma":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shawarma

body:
The Third Job of the [[Rogue (ragnarok online)|]]/[[Stalker (ragnarok online)|]] tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually have a [[holding dagger|dagger]] of some kind with an [[sheath]] but can also use [[holding bow (weapon)|bows]]. 


h4. Original Appearance
* !post #7301383
* !post #7301395
Males wear a [[fur collar]] over a [[shrug (clothing)|]], a [[smiley face]] on a [[chain]], a [[brown cape|brown]] [[waist cape]], [[fur-trimmed pants|fur-trimmed]] [[brown pants]] with a [[leopard print]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a [[cross-laced top|cross-laced]] [[brown coat]] and a [[fur-trimmed coat|fur trim]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[brown gloves|brown]] [[elbow gloves]] also with [[cross-laced gloves|cross-lacing]], a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[miniskirt]], [[lace-trimmed thighhighs|lace-trimmed]] [[grey thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels]]. 


h4. [[Official alternate costume|Second Costume]]
* !post #7306189
* !post #7306191
Males wear a [[fur collar]] on a [[brown cape|brown]] [[fur cape]], a [[chain necklace]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], a [[torn cape|torn]] [[black cape|black]] [[waist cape]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. 
Females wear a [[open coat|open]] [[brown coat|brown]] [[fur coat]], a [[red sports bra]], [[fur-trimmed sleeves|fur-trimmed]] [[red sleeves|red]] [[detached sleeves|sleeves]], [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], a [[fishnet thighhighs]], [[spiked anklet]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

title: momosuzu_nene_(new_year)
body:
The 3rd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Momosuzu Nene]].

It consists of a [[black bowtie]], [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]], an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[white kimono]] with a [[floral print|flower]] [[print kimono|print]], a [[brown capelet]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[blue hakama|hakama]] [[hakama skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[lace socks]] and [[black shoes]].

On March 31 2022, she got a Spring-themed version for this costume that with a [[official alternate costume|different color scheme]], with her hair bow now being teal-colored instead of blue, her bowtie now being [[red bowtie|red]] and her hakama is now [[pink hakama|pink]] instead of blue, her kimono also has a different pattern.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]]s with this costume:

* [[long hair|Long]] [[straight hair]] with [[sidelocks]]
* [[Short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs]] and a [[hair flower]] and a [[hair bow]]
* [[Short hair with long locks]] with [[sidelocks]] that was introduced for the spring version

All, 3 hairstyles are decorated with a large [[hair flower]] and a [[hair bow]].

Since Nene originally didn't get her official New Year's costume alongside the rest of NePoLaBo for 2021 due to her character design being reworked at the time, there are some [[design speculation|fan interpretations]] based on some early design concepts showed by Nene during "one of her streams":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2dODcM458Bg].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5022219: Profile (New Year version)
* !asset #23328317: Profile (Spring version)
* !post #4302402: Example art inspired by early designs

body:

Her casual clothes (named the "date costume") consist of a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[plaid shirt]] with a [[shoulder cutout]] and [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[puffy short sleeves|puffy]] [[lace]] [[lace sleeves|sleeves]] a [[black bowtie]] or [[neck ribbon]], a [[black choker]], a pair of [[flower earrings]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[brown skirt|dark brown]] or [[black skirt|black]] [[bow skirt|bow]] [[lace-trimmed skirt|lace-trimmed]] [[miniskirt]], [[grey socks|grey]] [[lace socks]] and [[black shoes]]. Other possible accessories include a [[white jacket|white]] inner-[[plaid jacket|plaid jacket]], a watch, [[black-framed eyewear|black]] [[glasses]] and a [[newsboy cap|cabbie hat]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Medium hair|Medium-length hair]] tied in a [[crown braid]] with [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[twintails]] [[twin drills]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]]

title: lace
body:
Clothing made entirely of lace. Lace is a delicate fabric, usually colored white, containing intricate web-like patterns.

[[Frills]] may be made of lace, but many are not lace, and not all lace is frilled. Lace is commonly misused to indicate [[frills]], so be careful with this tag.

Lace is often used for decorative [[lace trim]]. However, do not use the lace tag for clothing that simply has [[lace trim]]. Lace is for clothing that is completely made of lace.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Embellishment]]
* [[lace background]]
* [[lace border]]
* [[lace bra]]
* [[lace gloves]]
* [[lace panties]]
* [[lace pantyhose]]
* [[lace sleeves]]
* [[lace socks]]
* [[lace thighhighs]]
* [[lace trim]]
* [[lingerie]]
* [[doily]]

title: sakura_kyoko_(swimsuit_ver.)
body:
A [[official alternate costume|playable variant]] of [[Sakura Kyoko]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

Her [[very long hair|very long]] [[red hair]] is tied into a [[ponytail]] and is decorated with [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[hair flower|flowers]]. She also has [[parted bangs]] and [[red eyes]].

She wears a [[black choker|black]] [[lace choker|lace]] [[choker]] decorated with [[red gemstone|red]] [[gem]]s, a [[black bikini]] with a [[honeycomb print|honeycomb]]/[[hexagon print|hexagonal]] [[print bikini|print]], an [[armlet]] and a few [[bracelet]]s, a [[see-through sarong|see-through]] [[red sarong|red]] [[sarong]] with a [[print sarong|print]], and a pair of [[barefoot sandals (jewelry)|]].

Not to be confused with [[Sakura Kyoko (swimsuit costume)]], another costume for that character.

title: sakura_kyoko_(swimsuit_costume)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|unplayable costume]] of [[Sakura Kyoko]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

Her [[very long hair|very long]] [[red hair]] is tied into a [[ponytail]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]]. She also has [[parted bangs]] and [[red eyes]].

She wears a [[black bikini|black]] [[argyle bikini|argyle]] [[print bikini|print]] [[bikini]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[halterneck]] and [[side-tie bikini bottom|bows at sides]], along with a [[ring]] and some [[armlet]]s and [[bracelet]]s. She is [[barefoot]].

Not to be confused with [[Sakura Kyoko (swimsuit ver.)]], another costume for that character.

title: sigewinne_(genshin_impact)
body:
Sigewinne is playable Hydro character in [[Genshin Impact]], released in Version 4.7. As the head nurse of the Fortress of Meropide infirmary, she's a [[melusine_(genshin_impact)|Melusine]] with a unique physique closer to that of a human [spoiler]due to drinking a potion that changed her into her current form[/spoiler].

Her name is pronounced "SEEZJ-ween" (roughly, like the words "siege" and "wean").

h4. Appearance

* !post #7487490
* !post #8605768: [[Sigewinne (Luckin Coffee) (Genshin Impact)|Luckin Coffee]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Sigewinne":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Sigewinne]

title: navia_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character from Fontaine. The current president of the company Spina di Rosula, a position she inherited from her father, Callas, after his death. Despite losing many of her loved ones along the way, Navia continues pushing on, with the story serving as a coming-of-age story for her.

Her Vision element is Geo, and she wields a claymore and her Gunbrella in battle, the latter of which is a parasol equipped with a cannon. Her full name is Navia Caspar.

Japanese CV: [[Toyosaki Aki]]
English CV: Brenna Larsen
